excerpts:
Who doesn't love a local, authentic Taco truck conveniently located for a late-night-grab-n-go?

- Ordered 2 Tacos:
The chicken taco comes w/ shredded marinated chicken, cilantro, onions, salsa, lime, and radish.
The beef taco comes with diced beef & everything else same.
Fresh, authentic tortilla + a spice of mild salsa.
Meat & salsa together creates great texture & overall very satisfying.
*4 stars for the Tacos!
- Taco truck is located in front of Best Buy.
There are plenty of parking!!
taco.author: Jess W.
taco.review:
2.75 stars. (STORY below)

Visited first-time on a weekday night. Who doesn't love a local, authentic Taco truck conveniently located for a late-night-grab-n-go?

- Ordered 2 Tacos: Chicken & beef ($ 3 each-NOMS). And Quesadillas ($8 for 2). The chicken taco comes w/ shredded marinated chicken, cilantro, onions, salsa, lime, and radish. Very delicious! 

The beef taco comes with diced beef & everything else same. Fresh, authentic tortilla + a spice of mild salsa. Meat & salsa together creates great texture & overall very satisfying. (****4 stars for the Tacos!***)

- HOWEVER. This review is mainly for the Quesadilla. I've asked the lady "Is Quesadilla vegetarian?" The lady said yes. My 2 Quesadilla came w/ NO CHEESE, and RICE + BEANS!? (what kind of quesadilla is this.....it looks like an unwrapped burrito) 

Moreover, the Quesadilla includes a strange-tasting dressing.... that tastes like thousand island.... (By this time I'm so confused by what I've ordered... ***pictures below*****)

- I believe there might be a miscommunication, maybe a language barrier (I do not speak Spanish). I definitely don't think they intentionally did this. However, I was expecting my quesadilla to be cheesy!!!! Even if it was a burrito, it should be communicated to me........... 

- The staff actually answered my phone, when I called to ask for their accurate closing time. Good customer service in terms of being attentive on phone. 

- Taco truck is located in front of Best Buy. There are plenty of parking!!

excerpts: Taco truck?
Naw.
More like Burrito truck.
I was driving near best buy when I saw this Taco truck.
It should be Burrito truck!
Anyways, I parked and went to the taco truck to buy a Mild Chicken Burrito and Cold water.
The Chicken burrito was $8.00 and the water was $1.50 (Water $1.50?
Eh no.
I was thirsty
so it was worth it).
The chicken burrito was filled with cheese, beans, chicken, sour cream, guacamole and rice.
Omg this is the best burrito I've ever had at a taco truck.
The ingredients were good, the sauce was flavors were good, and the Burrito was gigantic!
Be sure to ask for extra napkins!
taco.author: Jonathan Z.
taco.review:
Taco truck? Naw. More like Burrito truck. I was driving near best buy when I saw this Taco truck. It should be Burrito truck! Anyways, I parked and went to the taco truck to buy a Mild Chicken Burrito and Cold water. The Chicken burrito was $8.00 and the water was $1.50 (Water $1.50? Eh no. I was thirsty so it was worth it). The chicken burrito was filled with cheese, beans, chicken, sour cream, guacamole and rice. Omg this is the best burrito I've ever had at a taco truck. The ingredients were good, the sauce was flavors were good, and the Burrito was gigantic! Be sure to ask for extra napkins! It will get messy!

Overall, if I am craving for Burritos, You betcha I'm going to be back! But seriously, water is $1.50.. I can go to Costco and get a whole pack of water for 3-5$. If I were you, I'll bring my own water next time.

excerpts: While attending the Lane 8 day party, we of course needed to grub and fortunately this taco truck was right there waiting for us.
Unfortunately, we were left unsatisfied from Dumpling Time and needed to satisfy thay empty hole of dissatisfaction.
Fortunately, this truck had an awesome deal for 3 tacos.
I appreciated that they cook their tacos to order, so that they're as fresh as possible.
It didn't take long for us to get our order and by just looking at them, we knew we were in for a treat.
I ended up ordering the 3 taco plate with al pastor, carnitas and chorizo.
The pastor and carnitas tacos were incredibly delicious with tons of flavor.
I was excited that the meats weren't salty and were juicy without being greasy.
However, I wasn't too crazy about the chorizo taco.
It wasn't horrible, but it wasn't rave worthy as well.
Overall, I would definitely order their al pastor or carnitas meats next time.
Perhaps, I'll try their quesadillas next time.

excerpts: I'm going to start off by saying I moved from Los Angeles, land of good and inexpensive taco trucks less than a year ago.
I've been disappointed with the lack of taco trucks and stands and finally did some yelp research and found El Tonayense Taco Truck.
I got in the car with 4 other hungry humans, drove over and pretty much skipped up to place my order, "three carne asada tacos, please.
Well, we were super bummed to hear they'd ran out of several meats including the carne asada.
We all decided on carnitas and al pastor - some tacos and some burritos.
Then it was time to pay.
Um, how can a single taco cost $3?!!?
I know things are more expensive up here but come on now, what happened to my $1.25-$1.50 price tag?
The tacos were very good but for $3 each I'd like to at least have somewhere to sit.

taco.review: I was craving tacos and this truck caught my eye in front of Best Buy. After my order I waited about ten minutes before hot tacos were served. I really enjoyed the beef taco. It was very juicy and chewy with a great green mild sauce on top. The only thing I didn't like is that the tortillas were soft from the juice of the beef. excerpts:
Did you say taco run?!? 

We had to smash at least one taco there before rushing back to the house to finish stuffing ourselves.
taco.author: Josh H.
taco.review:
This review is based on conversation held between myself and a friend of mine:

Yooooooo! 

Did you say taco run?!? 

Game on! Where are we going? You damn well know there isn't any parking over there right now. Insert Yelp tag line of "I know just the place"... We're going to Best Buy. 

Why and the hell would we go to Best Buy for food?!? Well my friend, you just bring your wallet since you're buying. So we roll up and park in the lot, (always plenty of parking here by the way) and hop out and approach "the truck". I knew exactly what I was there for since I have been here numerous times before. My buddy says he's in the mood for carne asada tacos and I tell him, you MUST try the carnitas! 

So he places his order for a couple of carne asada tacos and two carnitas one as well. I step up and order two carnitas, one carne asada and one al pastor as well as a horchata. There were already a couple of people waiting on their orders and before you knew it our orders were up. We had to smash at least one taco there before rushing back to the house to finish stuffing ourselves. 

These tacos come out piping hot and are insanely good! It makes you wonder if there is an underground tunnel leading to a kitchen with an army of grandmas throwing down on the most incredibly succulent meats you could possibly want to taste... Like it can't be possible that all of this goodness is contained to this little truck. 

My buddy has since become a loyal customer and has doesn't have to say more than I'm going to Best Buy for me to yell out what I need in my life. 

With this being said, do not hesitate to give this gem a shot, you will not be disappointed!

excerpts: I've been meaning to try this Taco Truck ever since I heard about it years ago.
as I was passing by Best Buy on 14th St., I caught a glimpse of the Taco Truck parked on the side of the curb.
Like any typical Taco Truck, the menu is posted on the side of the truck.
Wifey ordered the Bucha and I opted for the regular burrito and choose Lengua for protein.
Unlike some other Taco Trucks, our order came out quick and super fast.
(Take note here)
Wifey's Buche Taco was doused with a large amount of salsa verde that it was drowning and the meat needed to be recucitated.
There's better Taco Trucks out there.
taco.author: John G.
taco.review:
I've been meaning to try this Taco Truck ever since I heard about it years ago. If memory serves me right, I've had this bookmarked for over 5 years. 

Due to it's location, I rarely go to the area as it's always out of my way. 

This past Sunday as the Wifey picked me up from work, she wanted to go to Tartine Bakery. I took Harrison St. as it was the quickest way towards the Mission District and as I was passing by Best Buy on 14th St., I caught a glimpse of the Taco Truck parked on the side of the curb. I quickly made a U-turn and parked in the lot. 

There were only a few people in line and it went by quick. Like any typical Taco Truck, the menu is posted on the side of the truck. Wifey ordered the Bucha and I opted for the regular burrito and choose Lengua for protein. Aside from the aforementioned protein, they also have Asada, Al Pastor, Pollo, Pollo Asado, Carnitas, Cabeza, Tripitas and Vegeteriano for them plant-eating people. 

Unlike some other Taco Trucks, our order came out quick and super fast. (Take note here) Wifey's Buche Taco was doused with a large amount of salsa verde that it was drowning and the meat needed to be recucitated. On it's own, the meat was OK, but it was overpowered by the sauce. 

My Lengua was filled with inconsistency in terms of flavor and texture. I love Lengua, and I love that the meat is tender, moist and pops with bold, gamy, wonderful flavors....all were lacking in their version. Which dawned on me that they probably had everything prepped and reheated so that's why it came out fast. 

I prefer mines cooked to order so they won't dry while wilting under a heat lamp. 

I don't know what happened, but whatever they did in the past they're certainly not doing it now. I've heard so many good things about this place, but finally getting to experience it left me a bit disappointed. There's better Taco Trucks out there.

excerpts: This is a review for the El Tonayense Taco Truck parked right next to Best Buy.
This is the 2nd and last time I was disappointed at this place.
I ordered a Carne Asada Burrito (Super), and was given a wet, gushy, running burrito.
The sour cream, or some sauce tasted spoiled, and sour.
I had †ø
return it and ask for some asada tacos as a replacement.
I can't believe this place is still in business.
They have low quality ingredients, and the meat they use is either old, or just low quality.
It never taste fresh, and looks like some ground beef, or some mystery meat.
It's ok for the hipsters - they don't know good Tacos if it hit them in the face.
Save yourself from disappointment and stir clear of this place.
A couple of my friends also share similar experiences.
This place has caused people to literally get food poisoning.
I remember back in the days, before SF is what it is today, we had great quality taco trucks.
Now all the taco trucks on that street are terrible.
You can tell the quality and cleanliness is unacceptable for all these food establishments.
What's up SF?
Let's bring back quality taco trucks.

excerpts: I had like one taco and it was alright.
Secondly, I asked for grilled chicken and the one taco I did manage to eat was shredded chicken....like ummm...
taco.author: Kayla D.
taco.review:
We hired El Tonayense's truck to cater my graduation party last May.  I was so busy that day I barely had time to eat so this review is about their professionalism.  I had like one taco and it was alright.

Firstly, the truck ran out of food so not everyone at my party was able to eat.  We specifically told them the maximum amount of people so there's no excuse for this.  We also specifically asked for tacos and burritos (grilled chicken and carne asada) to be served and THAT'S IT.  These guys show up and they start taking everyone's order off their regular menu.  My guests didn't know any better.  People were getting super burritos and huge orders which caused them to run out hella quickly.  They should have explained to our guests what was available. They also showed up with Mexican cokes and all sorts of beverages that we didn't order and when our guests picked them out, asked them to pay for it out of pocket. 

Secondly, I asked for grilled chicken and the one taco I did manage to eat was shredded chicken....like ummm...ok.

We will not hire this company again.

excerpts: This is not just a taco truck, this is THE taco truck.
Taco-mania from now on.
taco.author: Sebastian F.
taco.review:
Tacos. Quesadillas. Burritos. Make it simple. This is not just a taco truck, this is THE taco truck.

Super fast service, super tasty food. I've had several tacos, a burrito, and if the quesadillas wouldn't have been sold out at 8pm on a Friday, I would've spend my bucks on those as well. 

Where else can you eat yourself through the entire universe of Mexican street food, roll back to your car, and drive home - satisfied, and already planning your next visit.  

Taco-mania from now on.

excerpts: I would recommend this taco truck!
taco.author: Michael Y.
taco.review: Awesome tacos! The guys working are also friendly and awesome too! I got to try their asada, al pastor, tripas, and neck tacos. They are well sized, well mixed with onions and greens, and come with a choice of mild or hot sauce. I went with the hot sauce, but the mild one seems better. I will have to try it next time. I would recommend this taco truck!

excerpts: i truly hope that they continue to serve the best carnitas taco around there.
enjoy them if you live there.
taco.author: J R.
taco.review: i just remembered this truck as it came up on some foodie show. it hurts my heart to consider how much i loved the tacos from this truck and even these things you love and hold very dearly can pass from memory after only 6 years. i miss so many things about the city of san francisco, tacos from this truck are one of them. i truly hope that they continue to serve the best carnitas taco around there. enjoy them if you live there.

excerpts: This ain't your typical roach coach taco truck.
taco.author: Janice C.
taco.review:
This ain't your typical roach coach taco truck. 

El Tonayense serves up the best carnitas/pollo/cabeza/carne asada/al pastor/horchata/insertanotherMexicancreationhere EVER.  The tacos are only $2 each and it will be the most flavorful, cheapest meal of your life. 

Park your car at the Best Buy lot and eat these while standing on the street. Casual, uncomplicated.  

Just the way life should be.

excerpts: This has been my favorite taco truck for years!!!
I tell everyone about this truck at this location.
I ADORE these tacos..
I hadn't been able to get here in about 6 months, and was eating sub-par tacos in the East Bay.
I didn't realize how sad my taco experiences had become until I had an opportunity to revisit my beloved El T on Harrison.
It's just a steak taco, right?
But these guys elevate it by making every component fresh and yummy, and the end result is absolute taco satisfaction!!!
taco.author: J M.
taco.review:
This has been my favorite taco truck for years!!!  I tell everyone about this truck at this location.  I ADORE these tacos..  I hadn't been able to get here in about 6 months, and was eating sub-par tacos in the East Bay. I didn't realize how sad my taco experiences had become until I had an opportunity to revisit my beloved El T on Harrison.

I ordered 3 carne asada spicy tacos, hopped into my car, and nearly wept when I took my first bite. Oh my dear God, with every bite, my eyes rolled in my head. Freshly made REAL corn tortillas, steak that actually doesn't chew like rubber pellets and is tender and cooked to order, radishes that taste FRESH, the whole plate was heaven. I could eat here every day if I lived in the City.  It's just a steak taco, right? But these guys elevate it by making every component fresh and yummy, and the end result is absolute taco satisfaction!!!

excerpts: Very flavorful and lots of juicy meat on each taco.
Even though the SOMA StrEat Food Park is right at the corner, this is still a really good (and more cost effective) option.
taco.author: Kathy L.
taco.review: Sister and I got some tacos today between errands at Best Buy and Costco, and they were yummy. I had a cabeza and an al pastor, and she had a cabeza. 3 tacos cost $7.50- not bad. Very flavorful and lots of juicy meat on each taco. Even though the SOMA StrEat Food Park is right at the corner, this is still a really good (and more cost effective) option.

excerpts: I know this little truck is famous for its tacos, but I'm not a huge taco fan.
I think they're kind of boring and lacking in ingredients...
and if you're super hungry they don't fill you up.
taco.author: Deanna Y.
taco.review:
Best. Burrito. EVER!!! 

I know this little truck is famous for its tacos, but I'm not a huge taco fan. I think they're kind of boring and lacking in ingredients...and if you're super hungry they don't fill you up. I have tried the tacos though and they ain't bad, so if you love 'em, get 'em!

...but those burritos. There's nothing like burying your face into a soft,  warm burrito on a foggy day...in Best Buy's parking lot. Their burritos are very saucy, which I like because it adds incredible flavor, but they can be a bit drippy so neat freaks beware! Good amount of rice, meat, etc. Their combination of ingredients works really well.

Whenever I eat Mexican food, I always hope that I'll be blown away, but I'm always disappointed by flavorless meat, and standard ingredients that fail to impress...but not this place...dare I say it's one of the best burritos I've ever had! I want to go back...NOW just thinking about it! This place is seriously underrated. They need to send out fleets of trucks to cover the entire city!

excerpts: Stick with taco's and burritos forget the guacamole and chips.
Excellent value
taco.author: George F.
taco.review:
Stopped by after seeing this on Check Please. This food truck is just outside the Best Buy in San Francisco. I ordered 2 super Al Pastor burritos and 1 guacamole and chips. $15 total.

The Burritos were excellent! Lots of flavor, and they have a Mexican Cheese that makes it special. 

The Guacamole is terrible! It's watery and soupy, no flavor. Chips were very lardy and greasy. 

Stick with taco's and burritos forget the guacamole and chips. Excellent value

excerpts: Usually I would find a taco truck in one of many "Off the Grid" food events.
But the mobile taco truck is parked a block away from my house and is located in front of the Chameleon Café on Thursday nights.

Her treat: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/uGM7PAmP2utWXjYcZkVpQQ?select=VHCEEgCUBkqpcH3_LHwdTQ

Kudos to the taco truck and owner of the Café: Melody for bringing the taco truck to my neck of the woods.
But the taco truck is a great choice.
taco.author: Matt G.
taco.review:
For some strange reason, 2012 is off to a positive start. 

Usually I would find a taco truck in one of many "Off the Grid" food events. But the mobile taco truck is parked a block away from my house and is located in front of the Chameleon Café on Thursday nights. Truck: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/uGM7PAmP2utWXjYcZkVpQQ?select=r0-luNfS5tM2bSo1bCOvZQ

I came here while my laundry is in the process. And I came here and enjoyed 4 tacos at $2.00 each. The grilled steak and grilled pork meats were really good in the warm corn tortilla. (I had outside seating, thus the picture of my evening meal is too dark. My apologies). My treat: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/uGM7PAmP2utWXjYcZkVpQQ?select=UXxn2yeeh3m3KP5xUamxQQ

I also got a Stone IPA beer from the Café. The local beer in a glass is $4.00. Beer tastes great with tacos. 

I also got a couple of tacos for my daughter's dinner after her homework is completed. A treat she can enjoy while watching San Jose Shark's hockey. Her treat: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/uGM7PAmP2utWXjYcZkVpQQ?select=VHCEEgCUBkqpcH3_LHwdTQ

Kudos to the taco truck and owner of the Café: Melody for bringing the taco truck to my neck of the woods. Melody is also trying to negotiate in acquiring other food trucks to park in front of her café. But the taco truck is a great choice.

excerpts: I'll try something new, but always finding myself walking across the street back to this taco truck.
I CRAVE their street tacos.
I have tried most of their meats, except for lengua...
and they're all sooo good!
The tripe and carnitas are my go-to meats.
The tripe isn't steamed, wet tripe (like in menudo or dim sum)
it's FRIED and CRUNCHY with SOO much flavor.
Almost like a fried pork skin/fat texture.
The carnitas have a perfect balance of crunchy and meaty.
It's not too fried to where you're biting down on rocks and the meats are hard to pull apart on the taco.
It's just crispy enough for you to know it's fried and soft enough to where it pulls apart on a bite.
taco.author: Michelle C.
taco.review:
Favorite Mexican food truck in SF. Seriously. 

I usually do a walk around the StrEat Food Park thinking I'll try something new, but always finding myself walking across the street back to this taco truck. I CRAVE their street tacos. I have tried most of their meats, except for lengua... and they're all sooo good! The tripe and carnitas are my go-to meats.The tripe isn't steamed, wet tripe (like in menudo or dim sum) it's FRIED and CRUNCHY with SOO much flavor. Almost like a fried pork skin/fat texture. The carnitas have a perfect balance of crunchy and meaty. It's not too fried to where you're biting down on rocks and the meats are hard to pull apart on the taco. It's just crispy enough for you to know it's fried and soft enough to where it pulls apart on a bite. Ugh drooling. 

Three tacos and a drink will satisfy me. Ask for spicy and they'll throw on some pickled jalapenos for ya!

excerpts: , I'm so glad I finally got to try the tacos at the El Tonayense Taco Truck by Best Buy that my friends have been raving about.
The El Tonayense Taco Truck can expect a return visit from me pretty soon.
taco.author: Jon L.
taco.review:
A Zagat pioneer for food trucks everywhere, I'm so glad I finally got to try the tacos at the El Tonayense Taco Truck by Best Buy that my friends have been raving about. 

At $1.75 each, it's a steal. The carnitas were flavorful and moist. The lengua (tongue) was extremely delicate and well prepared - not rubbery at all. The star without a doubt though is the cabeza. The meat from the head and cheek is just so incredibly tender that it almost melts in your mouth. Three flavorful tacos (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/uGM7PAmP2utWXjYcZkVpQQ?select=n4t4ZwTfWHLk0KkWDDGUAw) for a sub-$5 lunch? Score!

It's not fancy eats but it is great quality for little money. The El Tonayense Taco Truck can expect a return visit from me pretty soon.

excerpts: I hate doing bad reviews but damn,all the meats I tried,carnitas,buche,and tripas were flavorless,only reason for the second star because the portions in each taco are huge.
taco.author: Fidel A.
taco.review: I hate doing bad reviews but damn,all the meats I tried,carnitas,buche,and tripas were flavorless,only reason for the second star because the portions in each taco are huge.

excerpts: Anyway, El Tonayense just happens to serve up my favorite taco in the Bay Area.
It's just a truck parked outside Best Buy in the SoMa, but it's probably the most delicious, authentic, no-frills taco you can find.

The guys who work here are super nice and never interrupt my miserable attempt at speaking their native language; they just speak back to me in Spanish and if I don't understand something, "Si" is still a safe bet.
Make sure you each have a plate and eat ABOVE IT so that the taco goodness doesn't drip everywhere.
4) Buy wet naps somewhere because there will be a lingering smell on your fingertips for hours.
Although the taco smelled fantastic, the smell afterward does not.
5) Walk off whatever you just ate at nearby Sports Basement or Potrero Center.
taco.author: Olivia V.
taco.review:
If you know me, you know that Latin food is my favorite cuisine. If health was not an issue, I could probably eat it every meal for the rest of my life. Peruvian, Salvadorean, Puerto Rican, you name it and I love it. Anyway, El Tonayense just happens to serve up my favorite taco in the Bay Area. It's just a truck parked outside Best Buy in the SoMa, but it's probably the most delicious, authentic, no-frills taco you can find. The guys who work here are super nice and never interrupt my miserable attempt at speaking their native language; they just speak back to me in Spanish and if I don't understand something, "Si" is still a safe bet. I also love how they kind of do their own thing instead of participating at Off the Grid or SoMa StrEat Food Park.

How To El Tonayense Like a Pro...
1) Park in the Best Buy lot and bring cash. (Avoid the lunch rush, if possible!)
2) Order the Asada, Al Pastor, and Lengua/tongue (if you are adventurous). Order a horchata to split with someone since it is very sweet and gets to be too much if you drink it alone...hopefully you're not there eating alone. Ask them to separate the tacos on a couple paper plates...this becomes important later.
3) After getting your food, go back to your car and eat it on top of the trunk, standing up. It is most often windy here, so try to use the cup of horchata as a paperweight for the napkins. USE THE LIME THEY GIVE YOU. Sometimes it's a lemon slice. Make sure you each have a plate and eat ABOVE IT so that the taco goodness doesn't drip everywhere.
4) Buy wet naps somewhere because there will be a lingering smell on your fingertips for hours. Although the taco smelled fantastic, the smell afterward does not.
5) Walk off whatever you just ate at nearby Sports Basement or Potrero Center.

excerpts: The boyfriend introduced this taco truck to me over the Holidays 2012 and since then, I can't seem to stop craving these delicious tacos!
They seriously have the best grilled chicken tacos I've EVER tried
and there's a lot of chicken tacos out there.
taco.author: Sandy L.
taco.review:
The boyfriend introduced this taco truck to me over the Holidays 2012 and since then, I can't seem to stop craving these delicious tacos!  They seriously have the best grilled chicken tacos I've EVER tried and there's a lot of chicken tacos out there.  It's a bit out of the way for me, but I still find myself making special trips to make our orders and then have a side excuse to browse through Best Buy and Office Max on the same block.

The prices are extremely affordable.  I can't remember the exact price but it is under $2 and so worth every bite.  I order two and then I find myself wanting to order another couple not because of the portion sizes but because the FLAVORS are amazing!  It's very fresh and you bite in and you can taste the grilled chicken, lemon, cilantro and onions all mixed together on a hot soft tortilla.  So SIMPLE, so AMAZING!

excerpts: Food poisoning aside, the taco definitely wasn't worth the elevated price (or even $2.50).
Worst place ever!
taco.author: Ruth C.
taco.review: Food Poisoning!!! Beyond sick after eating here. Had the el pastor. Also, paid $8.50 instead of $2.50 like other reviews mentioned. I guess they have selective pricing, which explains why the menu has no prices. Food poisoning aside, the taco definitely wasn't worth the elevated price (or even $2.50). Worst place ever!

excerpts: If you need a taco and see this truck run to it.
taco.author: Geoff G.
taco.review: Why are these tacos so good? I have no idea why they'd be so much better than other tacos. And it's coming out of a food truck. The mystery grows as you learn more about this food truck. I wanted a burrito, and I got one from this truck and it wasn't very good. Why can they make the tacos so awesome and can't make the burritos well? What's going on here? How do they do it? If you need a taco and see this truck run to it.

excerpts: Their spicy veggie taco is one of the best - they have some hookup on their tomatoes - they are always SO FLAVORFUL.
taco.author: Vivek S.
taco.review:
Hands down the best tacos in the city. Always parked in front of the Best Buy - I send everyone there for great food, fast service, and great prices!

Tacos are $2.50 to $3 (veggie vs meat). Their spicy veggie taco is one of the best - they have some hookup on their tomatoes - they are always SO FLAVORFUL.

Simple tacos - great service - and perfect price! You can also rent the truck for a pretty affordable price - like $800-$900 for 2-3 hours (great for parties - or in my case I am going to cater my wedding with them).

Also - the truck is michelin rated (no stars - but mentioned in the guide!)

Open till about 10pm most days and nights.

excerpts: And can we just say, $2 a taco?
taco.author: Niketa R.
taco.review:
I hired the Tonayense truck to cater a company lunch for my animation studio, and they were AMAZING! We're already eager to have them back.

First, the tacos were so delicious! They get the meat so tender, and everyone especially liked their beans and rice. Pretty presentation too. And can we just say, $2 a taco? It's like a perfect meal!

Elsa, the coordinator, was responsive and professional. The head cook Damon was incredibly friendly and really made sure everyone was taken care of. The prices are awesome, there was no cleanup on our part ... pretty much a perfect catering situation.

Highly recommended! 5 stars.

excerpts: I keep searching for my go to al pastor taco joint, and I'm just not convinced this is it.
It's good, though the carnitas are definitely better.
The al pastor is just so. .
.saucy
I guess.
I'm looking for that "sliced off the spit" kind of al pastor that has that sweet crispness without so much orange, oily sauce.
That said - they were delicious - just not exactly what I'm hunting for.
The tortas are very good - definitely a great taco truck option.
taco.author: Jennifer D.
taco.review:
I keep searching for my go to al pastor taco joint, and I'm just not convinced this is it.  It's good, though the carnitas are definitely better.  The al pastor is just so. . .saucy I guess.  I'm looking for that "sliced off the spit" kind of al pastor that has that sweet crispness without so much orange, oily sauce.
That said - they were delicious - just not exactly what I'm hunting for.  The tortas are very good - definitely a great taco truck option.

excerpts: This place does rank as one of my favorite taco spots in the Bay Area, though.
So relatively speaking, they get 4 stars.
taco.author: Abraham L.
taco.review:
NOW HOLD ON JUST ONE MINUTE AMIGO, don't grow your Mexi-stache just yet. This isn't exactly authentic Mexican comfort food, but it might do for now.

Pros: 
Killer al pastor tacos;
Cheap prices; 
Pretty decent carne asada tacos

Cons:
Salty chicken tacos
Horchata tastes like liquid cake frosting
...errrm, that's it.

It seems like the further away from the border you go, the more they get it wrong. The tacos didn't quite hold up to the high standards of Mexico nor LA (Tacos El Korita gets 5 stars, mmmm hand made tortillas, I highly recommend it). But then again, no one else in the Bay Area gets it right either. 

This place does rank as one of my favorite taco spots in the Bay Area, though. So relatively speaking, they get 4 stars.

taco.review: Buttery dubbery tortilla, with some tender ass carnitas, some special-ass guac (hyper-cilantroed? what is that? I like that!) burrito. Hit 3 tacos/3 meats first and went back for the real deal with the choicest of the 3 meats, need I spell it again? Sit on your car's hood in the Best Buy lot, and eat the cream baby. Not sloppy, not fancy and clean, but this better than best buy is taco truck wet dream.

excerpts: El Tonayense Taco Truck is not your "roach coach" taco truck, nor is it your frou frou/hipster "fusion-cuisine" food truck.
taco.author: Matt S.
taco.review:
What a fun place!  El Tonayense Taco Truck is not your "roach coach" taco truck, nor is it your frou frou/hipster "fusion-cuisine" food truck.  Simply put: El Tonayense will offer you delicious Mexican food without the formality of a restaurant.

Get the tacos:  My favorite thing to order are the tacos with a cup of horchata!  The tacos are served "street style:" small, flour tortillas piled high with your choice of meat and your choice of mild or spicy salsa.

Quantity: 2 tacos is perfect for a snack, 4 for a lunch. 

Meat: If you are feeling adventurous, try the lengua (tongue).  I've recently gotten into tongue, it is absolutely the most tender meat you will sink your teeth into, as it'll melt in your mouth.  The carnitas (fried pork) was also delicious.  It's a little fatty, but that's the best part, and will contribute to the flavors!

I would recommend finding a curb nearby to enjoy your food--literally street food.  These tacos, will make a mess so be sure to get lots of napkins or pack the wet naps.  Like Carl's Junior ads state, if it doesn't get all over the place, it doesn't belong in your face...and these tacos definitely belong in your face!  So good!

excerpts: I really don't know why people are leaving such wonderful reviews for this taco truck.
All of them were the greasiest, most unpleasant Mexican items I've ever ordered, and I'm absolutely huge on Mexican food and taco trucks.
taco.author: Tyler H.
taco.review:
I really don't know why people are leaving such wonderful reviews for this taco truck. I've never had a truck and its employees treat me and my friends so poorly or make me feel so sick as El Tonayese.

I've tried multiple items and given it a few shots. Carnitas tacos, al pastor burritos, chicken quesadilla. All of them were the greasiest, most unpleasant Mexican items I've ever ordered, and I'm absolutely huge on Mexican food and taco trucks.

I think the final straw was when a co-worker tried ordering a burrito without sour cream. Well they put sour cream on it anyway, so he took it back to the truck to have them fix the order. When he got back to the office, he unwrapped the burrito from the foil only to find a bunch of rolled up tortillas in burrito form. It was pretty funny, but pretty screwed up of them to do, and I wouldn't have taken it lightly if that happened to me.

You're better off buying a bag of Doritos than any item from this truck.

excerpts: I went to this taco truck today.
I said I wanted a burrito with no cilantro
(I have a cilantro allergy).
They gave me a burrito with cilantro guacamole sauce all over it.
Tons of cilantro.
So I took it back and politely said that I'd asked for a burrito with no cilantro, so please remake it.
The woman, who I think might be the owner, gets pissed off at me, and walks away and says I'm wrong.
That I said no cilantro, but not no guacamole.
Why would I want no 'fresh cilantro' but want a sauce that's full of the stuff?
Makes no sense.
She ignored me at first and leaves to go do something else while I stand there waiting.
She was hoping I would leave with my cilantro-covered food.
She finally comes back, grabs my burrito and chucks it hard into the trash with a disgusted look on her face.
They remake the burrito with.
I cilantro
but she comes back over to me at the end to make a point that it wasn't her fault, it was my fault.
And I try to say something back to her
and she ignores me and walks away.
I can't believe the service here.
She's taken my order several times before and made it cilantro free because I said "no cilantro in my burrito".
I guess the rules changed and it's my fault
I didn't say "please no cilantro, no guacamole if it has cilantro, no Salsa if it has cilantro, no meat if it has cilantro, etc....

excerpts: You might not think that it's a great place to get a taco, but you'd be wrong.
The tacos here are no frills but hands down delicious, and this is considering my extensive experience testing tacos when I lived in Dallas (which has excellent tacos by the way).
taco.author: Brent W.
taco.review:
This truck sits on Harrison at around 14th street, just outside of Best Buy. You might not think that it's a great place to get a taco, but you'd be wrong. The tacos here are no frills but hands down delicious, and this is considering my extensive experience testing tacos when I lived in Dallas (which has excellent tacos by the way). I went for the carne asada, and it was fresh and well spiced, with onions, cilantro, and some pickled jalapenos and veggies which were a nice addition.

I haven't tried a burrito, but I expect it to be amazing as well. The only down side to this place is that there isn't really a convenient place to eat. Maybe better if you just pick it up and take it home?

excerpts: Best taco truck on the SF side of the Bay.
Better burritos and tacos than most sit-down Tacquerias.
taco.author: Sandeep C.
taco.review: Best taco truck on the SF side of the Bay. Better burritos and tacos than most sit-down Tacquerias.

excerpts: For the simple fact to which I have eaten off of this taco truck several times and one of those times being when my old job brought them to our hotel for employee appreciation week... I freaked out with joy.
From the lingua and cabesa tacos all the way to the classic carne asada with cebolla y cilantro!
Nothing bad ever came from this company that are connoisseurs of the tacos!
A must try if you're ever over near best buy close the mission/ potrero!
