taco.review: An all time favorite of tacos done right. For the simple fact to which I have eaten off of this taco truck several times and one of those times being when my old job brought them to our hotel for employee appreciation week... I freaked out with joy. From the lingua and cabesa tacos all the way to the classic carne asada with cebolla y cilantro! Nothing bad ever came from this company that are connoisseurs of the tacos! A must try if you're ever over near best buy close the mission/ potrero!

excerpts: The meat is decently flavorful, but all the taco is is lime, cilantro, onions, and the meat on a tortilla.
And they definitely don't given enough lime.
Some of the meat is a little dry, and so since there's no sauce, it ends up being a pretty dry taco overall.
taco.author: Lucy H.
taco.review:
Good if you're not from Southern California.

If you're looking for some decent Mexican food in Northern California, this place is great. But, if you're used to authentic, killer flavor Mexican like you find in Southern California, look elsewhere. I ordered a sampling of meats (5 different ones), they didn't have the tripe when I went, which was disappointing. Most of the meats I had tasted so similar that I couldn't even tell which was which. The meat is decently flavorful, but all the taco is is lime, cilantro, onions, and the meat on a tortilla. And they definitely don't given enough lime.  Some of the meat is a little dry, and so since there's no sauce, it ends up being a pretty dry taco overall.

excerpts: Bust out your crumply dollars, jingle your pockets for quarters and bring yourself over to this taco truck.
Grab an al pastor or cabeza taco and get em' spicy!
I personally would pass on the carne asada taco which isn't as tasty as the other meats/organs.
taco.author: Maya S.
taco.review:
$1.75 for Mexican street tacos?! Bust out your crumply dollars, jingle your pockets for quarters and bring yourself over to this taco truck. Grab an al pastor or cabeza taco and get em' spicy! I personally would pass on the carne asada taco which isn't as tasty as the other meats/organs. In just a few minutes, your tacos will be ready on a paper plate for immediate consumption. 

Also, for a sweet treat, get a horchata which is nicely flavored with extra cinnamon!

excerpts: 2 bucks for a taco?
Next time I'm getting three or so.
Service was fast and friendly, definitely worth it!
taco.author: Royal B.
taco.review:
Came here on tuesday and the standard beef tacos were simply amazinggggggggg. 2 bucks for a taco? Next time I'm getting three or so.
Service was fast and friendly, definitely worth it!

excerpts: When you hit up Best Buy, have a taco on the way out.
taco.author: Bill G.
taco.review:
Carne Assad please.

Solid effort. When you hit up Best Buy, have a taco on the way out.

excerpts: All the taco trucks in the bay area lead me back to this one.
These are the best tacos ever and one of my favorite food trucks.
taco.author: Mimi V.
taco.review:
All the taco trucks in the bay area lead me back to this one. These are the best tacos ever and one of my favorite food trucks. Restaurant tacos cannot compare.

It's located right next to Best Buy, which is how I found it the first time. Now, I go there even when it's out of my way, and there's always a line! 

My favorite are the carnitas (spicy). It's really not that hot. Also, make sure you get the pickled jalapenos. Those make your meal extra tasty.

excerpts: With taco trucks all the rage, I always find it kind of odd now when I see a taco truck that sells Mexican tacos.
Don't get me wrong...
I think this whole taco truck phenomenon is pretty awesome.
Just that a taco truck that sells regular tacos are becoming (relatively) harder to find!
The tacos are pretty darn cheap considering how loaded they are - $1.95 for a taco chock full of meatiness goodness and topped with Jalapeno strips (we got them spicy).
I forgot to count the exact number of choices they list (maybe about eight?), but their menu offers a variety of meats to choose from.
Since I wasn't feeling too particularly frisky, opted to go with just a carnitas taco, while my friend went for a carne asada and a beef tongue.
I didn't get a chance to try my friend's carne asada taco, but I did get to steal a piece of beef tongue.
I've had beef tongue before and for whatever reason, I expected the meat to be a little on the tough side.
After ordering, I kinda wish I had ordered more than just my one taco, but I resisted the urge since it looked as though they were getting ready to pack up for the night.
The next time I see them though, I'll be sure to try one of their burritos - with some tacos on the side!
taco.author: Mike L.
taco.review:
With taco trucks all the rage, I always find it kind of odd now when I see a taco truck that sells Mexican tacos.  Don't get me wrong...I think this whole taco truck phenomenon is pretty awesome.  Just that a taco truck that sells regular tacos are becoming (relatively) harder to find!

After meeting up with a friend at the SoMa Best Buy, we wandered across the parking lot to grab ourselves a snack on a cold night.  The tacos are pretty darn cheap considering how loaded they are - $1.95 for a taco chock full of meatiness goodness and topped with Jalapeno strips (we got them spicy).  I forgot to count the exact number of choices they list (maybe about eight?), but their menu offers a variety of meats to choose from.  Since I wasn't feeling too particularly frisky, opted to go with just a carnitas taco, while my friend went for a carne asada and a beef tongue.

The carnitas were really moist and flavorful, although I didn't get much of a bite/crunch that I thought I would get.  Regardless though, I liked the sauce for the carnitas and was really glad that the meat wasn't all dried out.  The jalapeno strips definitely gave it some heat, but not overpoweringly so.  I didn't get a chance to try my friend's carne asada taco, but I did get to steal a piece of beef tongue.  I've had beef tongue before and for whatever reason, I expected the meat to be a little on the tough side.  Instead, it was actually pretty tender.

After ordering, I kinda wish I had ordered more than just my one taco, but I resisted the urge since it looked as though they were getting ready to pack up for the night.  The next time I see them though, I'll be sure to try one of their burritos - with some tacos on the side!

excerpts: Prices are LOW, $2 a taco, $6 a burrito, $7 for super burrito.
That having been said it's nothing too exciting, just your standard greasy roach coach taco truck burrito.
taco.author: Tomas K.
taco.review:
Stopped by El Toyanese today to see what all the hype was about, ordered an al pastor super burrito and a lime jarritos. Prices are LOW, $2 a taco, $6 a burrito, $7 for super burrito. That having been said it's nothing too exciting, just your standard greasy roach coach taco truck burrito. 

It seems like most of their business comes from a mix of Best Buy / OfficeMax customers, employees, and drifters wandering under the highway. The burrito was nothing to write home about but
for $7 who is complaining?

excerpts: Head and cheeks taco!
Name an internal organ...
they'll put a tortilla around it...
taco.author: Ed U.
taco.review:
Tongue taco!...Tripe taco!...Brains taco!...Head and cheeks taco!
Name an internal organ...they'll put a tortilla around it...Que Aproveche!

Y'know, I think "Check, Please! Bay Area" is starting to become more of an addiction than I care to admit. I've passed by this truck many, many times, but I didn't think twice about trying it until a guy on the show chose it as his favorite culinary destination and even brought sample tacos for the other guests. Impressive...though I was wondering how successful his dates are if this is what he considers fine dining.

Now I'm no snob when it comes to food made in a motor vehicle. In fact, I'm a sucker for the 53rd and 6th Halal Cart every time I go to New York (http://www.yelp.com/biz/53rd-and-6th-halal-cart-new-york#hrid:jVK8_2qtXO3UU7R5hS9XIg) There are three of these El Tonayense Trucks around the Mission, but this one is an instant draw since you can just park in the huge Best Buy parking lot. Jamie W. and I got there at around 8pm, and they were down to just beef as the meat selection.

I went for the $5.50 Super Torta, which came piled with beef and oozing with a sauce filled with cheese, guacamole, salsa, green onions and sour cream. It was a huge mess to eat out of the quadruple-wrapped aluminum foil, but I managed. Jamie had the $6 Super Burrito, and he was having the same overflow issue. We decided to park ourselves next to the wall of the Best Buy where passersby gawked at us. Don't judge us.

FOOD - 4 stars...good, hearty stuff...darn fresh ingredients...need to come earlier so I can pick out my favorite internal organ
AMBIANCE - 2 stars...you're kidding, right?
SERVICE - 4 stars...andale, andale!
TOTAL - 4 stars...cheap eats on wheels...bring your own card table...and folding chair

excerpts: From my experience I have had the taco lady/guy cater to many birthday parties before but they only tugged around their grill with some of their food pre-made already.
The difference between them and El Tonayense??
taco.author: Kathy V.
taco.review:
If you want to hire these folks to cater your next party, it's a hit!! The way I stumbled onto this truck was by attending my friend son's 1st year old birthday at a park. What a great idea huh? From my experience I have had the taco lady/guy cater to many birthday parties before but they only tugged around their grill with some of their food pre-made already. The difference between them and El Tonayense?? Uhh they make theirs fresh on the spot and you have a bunch of choices besides tacos!! 

For one they have Burritos, Tacos, & Quesadilla's. Typically other vendors just serve Pollo, Asada and Al Pastor. This truck had Lengua, Cabeza, Vegetarian, Tripe, Buche, Pollo.. you name it. I ordered Chicken Quesadilla and Carne Asada Burrito. My first bite of my burrito was soooo juicy and the beef was tender. Not a lot of rice which I liked and not too much beans. Some of the burritos Ive came across has too much rice!! and not enough meat. My burrito did not need hot sauce as well, the burrito itself was flavorful and made me stuffed!!! As for the Quesadilla, I found it to be a little too spicy for my kid to eat but she liked it!! hahaha The portion size they served can be for two adults. She only ate two pieces and I tried 1 bite. We both did not finish our food, but I packed it to go.. 20 mins later the host of the party says the truck is leaving in 10 mins so you better get some to go. Why did I go back? hahaha I decided to try out the Lingua. RESULTS? YAY I'm a fan, even though it was my first time to try it. I gotta be open to more food this year. BURP!!

excerpts: Love this taco truck.
It's parked conveniently outside of Mission Cliffs, so whenever you're down climbing and lifting, just hit up this truck for some legitimate Mexican food at a great price.
The meat doesn't taste as juicy as it would at a restaurant/taqueria, but for a taco shop, it does a damn good job of putting together an al pastor burrito.
taco.author: Danny C.
taco.review: Love this taco truck. It's parked conveniently outside of Mission Cliffs, so whenever you're down climbing and lifting, just hit up this truck for some legitimate Mexican food at a great price. The meat doesn't taste as juicy as it would at a restaurant/taqueria, but for a taco shop, it does a damn good job of putting together an al pastor burrito.

excerpts: My taco-loving friend, Julie, has been yammering (and I mean that in a cute, endearing way) on about this truck since I met her.
So on a night where booze was the agenda and a little foodish cushion sounded like a wise idea before we consumed our weight in bourbon
I went with the carnitas taco and the 2 carne asada tacos.
The CA's were friggin' solid.
Meat was moist, melt-in-yo-mouth tender and had just enough kick to keep your pants on, but also get your senses tingling with glee.
The carnitas were tasty, but they weren't as good as the carne asada, but I find that to be true at many places.
I would highly recommend this truck for your taco-face-stuffing needs.
It's cheap,
it's easy and it's deelish!
taco.author: Stephy S.
taco.review:
My taco-loving friend, Julie, has been yammering (and I mean that in a cute, endearing way) on about this truck since I met her. So on a night where booze was the agenda and a little foodish cushion sounded like a wise idea before we consumed our weight in bourbon, we decided to come here and get our grub on. 

I went with the carnitas taco and the 2 carne asada tacos. The CA's were friggin' solid. Meat was moist, melt-in-yo-mouth tender and had just enough kick to keep your pants on, but also get your senses tingling with glee. The carnitas were tasty, but they weren't as good as the carne asada, but I find that to be true at many places. Maybe I am just super picky about carnitas (yep, most definitely the case).

I would highly recommend this truck for your taco-face-stuffing needs. It's cheap, it's easy and it's deelish! What the hell more do you want? 

Yeah, I thought so.

excerpts: When it comes to taco trucks, this is about as good as it gets.
If you're willing to try something different because it's delicious, get the lengua (tongue) burrito or taco.
So tender.
taco.author: suzanne l.
taco.review:
When it comes to taco trucks, this is about as good as it gets.  

If you're willing to try something different because it's delicious, get the lengua (tongue) burrito or taco.  So tender.  They braise it for a really long time to get it that soft.  

My other go-to are the beef tacos.  Nom.

excerpts: LA taco truck state of mind aside
Probably one of the better taco trucks in the area.
The al pastor feels good in the mouth and exudes the oil of glory, and the tripas was crispy and flavorful.
This isn't supposed to be a gourmet taco truck.
I'll be back once I have a deep taco craving.
taco.author: Stephen L.
taco.review:
LA taco truck state of mind aside, this place is A-OK.

Probably one of the better taco trucks in the area. The al pastor feels good in the mouth and exudes the oil of glory, and the tripas was crispy and flavorful. Super Burritos are super indeed--quite a combination of flavors mixed in my mouth. 

HOWEVER, nothing on the menu is worth its price. Tacos should never cost $2+ unless you're at Baja Fresh or something. This isn't supposed to be a gourmet taco truck. Conflicted.

But thanks, El Tonayense for a good experience. I'll be back once I have a deep taco craving.

excerpts: but I can without hesitation say that this Taco truck has the best carne asada tacos I have ever had (in the U.S.).
I don't make that statement without having a lifetime of tacos and street food from Los Angeles to San Francisco.
I eat street tacos...a LOT.
I work in the Mission.
I challenge you to take me somewhere where I can get a better taco.
I've been to many of the high end Mexican places in the bay area and LA.
You will NOT get a more savory taco than at El Tonayense.
My recommendation is to get the carne asada taco with the non-spicy green sauce with cheese on top.
taco.author: Carlos A.
taco.review:
I'm not absolute about a lot of things but I can without hesitation say that this Taco truck has the best carne asada tacos I have ever had (in the U.S.). I don't make that statement without having a lifetime of tacos and street food from Los Angeles to San Francisco. I eat street tacos...a LOT. I work in the Mission. I am fluent in Spanish and enjoy trying as many tacos as I can in my free time at lunch. 

I challenge you to take me somewhere where I can get a better taco. I've been to many of the high end Mexican places in the bay area and LA. You will NOT get a more savory taco than at El Tonayense. My recommendation is to get the carne asada taco with the non-spicy green sauce with cheese on top. 

I can't speak for the carnitas, chicken or sesos but carne asada is to die for. 

To make things even better you can get two tacos and and horchata for $5. And...there is easy parking at Best Buy. So there you go: get your gadget fix at Best Buy and get tasty and cheap tacos. 

Seriously - I challenge you to take me somewhere with better tacos. $5 on El Tonayense any day of the week.

excerpts: Best taco truck in SF.
Usually combo up the al pastor, steak and chicken tacos because they're all delicious.
Cheap and they churn tacos and burritos out super quick.
Hard to make it back to work when you see everyone else shoveling tacos in the Best Buy parking lot.
taco.author: German L.
taco.review: Best taco truck in SF. Usually combo up the al pastor, steak and chicken tacos because they're all delicious. Cheap and they churn tacos and burritos out super quick. Hard to make it back to work when you see everyone else shoveling tacos in the Best Buy parking lot.

excerpts:
Me: A taco with pollo asado.
Oh 
yeah, 
I want no cebollas!
-guy smiles-
Guy: I'll be sure to put extra onions on your taco!
Me: NOOOOOO!!!!!!!
taco.author: Elaine N.
taco.review:
Guy: Hola! Como estas?
Me: Bien! Y tu?
Guy: What would you like?
Me: A taco with pollo asado.
Oh yeah, I want no cebollas!
-guy smiles-
Guy: I'll be sure to put extra onions on your taco!
Me: NOOOOOO!!!!!!!
-guy laughs at me-
-me finds out he lied and was just making fun of me-
):

Yay for super nice workers......

Yay for free tacos, courtesy of gdgt!

Aside from the scare and all the grease that leaked all over my plate, napkins, hand, and jacket, everything was pretty good.

Yay for jalapenos that burned the shit out of my mouth and made my face red while I was at my meeting!

Oh yeah, it turns out I checked into the closed version of El Tonayense..... Not cool. It's a damn truck, it's still moving and the name isn't dead yet, how in the world is it closed?!?

excerpts: Had the asada and length taco.
Meat not seasoned and warm.
No fork.
GUACAMOLE WAS RUNNY.
Disappointed
taco.author: Cynthia C.
taco.review: Tried for THE first time. Had the asada and length taco. Meat not seasoned and warm. No fork. GUACAMOLE WAS RUNNY. Disappointed

excerpts: $2 for a large taco - really liked the roasted chicken.
Tasty filling and cheap.
(Better than the pork or the regular chicken)
taco.author: Vivian W.
taco.review: Yummy!  $2 for a large taco - really liked the roasted chicken.  Tasty filling and cheap.  (Better than the pork or the regular chicken)

excerpts: My husband LOVES the El Tonayense taco truck in SF (the one by Best Buy), so it would only make sense that he would want his beloved tacos as part of our wedding.
We hired one of the El Tonayense Taco Trucks for my wedding reception, to provide the midnight snack for my guests.
Overall, I was pretty happy with the service.
Guests were happy with their tacos & Jarritos soda, and the portions were just right as a 'little treat' to our guests after a night of drinking and dancing.
Pricing is VERY fair considering that they had to come outside of San Francisco on a Saturday night, during prime food-truck hours!
Vinicio (gentleman working with me on scheduling and pricing at their home base) was very responsive with my initial inquiry and super helpful when helping me decide what to serve our guests.
taco.author: Melanie C.
taco.review:
My husband LOVES the El Tonayense taco truck in SF (the one by Best Buy), so it would only make sense that he would want his beloved tacos as part of our wedding. 

We hired one of the El Tonayense Taco Trucks for my wedding reception, to provide the midnight snack for my guests. Overall, I was pretty happy with the service. Guests were happy with their tacos & Jarritos soda, and the portions were just right as a 'little treat' to our guests after a night of drinking and dancing. 
 
Pricing is VERY fair considering that they had to come outside of San Francisco on a Saturday night, during prime food-truck hours! Vinicio (gentleman working with me on scheduling and pricing at their home base) was very responsive with my initial inquiry and super helpful when helping me decide what to serve our guests.

excerpts: It was a pleasure working with El Tonayense Taco Truck.
We hired them for our wedding and the guests loved it.
They came on time and did their thing...and then they gave us all the leftover food because we did not spend our limit!
More tacos all around!
taco.author: Schelly Y.
taco.review: It was a pleasure working with El Tonayense Taco Truck. We hired them for our wedding and the guests loved it. They came on time and did their thing...and then they gave us all the leftover food because we did not spend our limit! More tacos all around!

excerpts: This taco truck served what are inarguably the best tacos I've ever eaten...in my LIFE.
I know, I know.
It seems like another tired Yelper making some hyperbolic review for the sake of sounding kitschy.
You can get any taco for $2 + .50 for super style.
Prices include tax.
I highly recommend the carne asada and carnitas tacos bout of this world.
taco.author: Jake K.
taco.review:
If you're a fan of tacos...

If you don't mind eating standing up...

If you can take a cab to the Best Buy...

THEN DO IT.

This taco truck served what are inarguably the best tacos I've ever eaten...in my LIFE. I know, I know. It seems like another tired Yelper making some hyperbolic review for the sake of sounding kitschy. Not this guy, not this time. 

Get a variety of tacos done super style for some sour cream, cheese, and guac. You can get any taco for $2 + .50 for super style. Prices include tax. I highly recommend the carne asada and carnitas tacos bout of this world.

excerpts: Two stars instead of one because it was better than taco bell.
taco.author: Stephie M.
taco.review:
Two stars instead of one because it was better than taco bell.

My burrito was made very sloppily and it didn't have enough meat in it to even notice it was a meat burrito!

The flavor in whatever sauce they used was NOT authentic mexican at all, and although we asked for spicy salsa, it tasted lighter than mild!   

On top of all of this, the guy working at this place was giving off bad vibes.

excerpts: My "taco/burrito" spot when I head home after a morning jog....and to do some side-shopping at Best Buy :)
I'll say this taco truck is one of the few places where the taco, burrito, quesadilla, etc. is NOT oily.
I usually stick to Carne Asada or Al Pastor, but so far, every type of meat I've chosen has been marinated well and taste awesome.
You know how when you are towards the end of your burrito, that whole section is usually pretty saucy and wet due to 'gravity'?
taco.author: Dave L.
taco.review:
My "taco/burrito" spot when I head home after a morning jog....and to do some side-shopping at Best Buy :)

I'll say this taco truck is one of the few places where the taco, burrito, quesadilla, etc. is NOT oily. I usually stick to Carne Asada or Al Pastor, but so far, every type of meat I've chosen has been marinated well and taste awesome. You know how when you are towards the end of your burrito, that whole section is usually pretty saucy and wet due to 'gravity'? Well, the way they made the burrito here...it doesn't get soggy all the way to the last bite.

Got to mention the service as well. It is top-notch and the dudes in the truck are nice and aware of who ordered what (I'm especially grateful when there's a long 'waiting' line and some customers order the same type of burrito, so you can imagine some 'hey, i ordered that burrito so I'm going to take it even though I just ordered 2 mins ago' syndrome). That's right muchacha....I have my eye on you next time I'm there....you line cutter...and you...'but I ordered that burrito too!' Grrrrrr

excerpts: I just polished off the tastiest torta and taco and felt moved enough to write a review.
So so good!!!
My al pastor taco was perfectly seasoned without being greasy (usually the norm for al pastor tacos).
The pollo torta was equally as tasty.
Once again my hands were not dripping in grease and the flavors were spot on.
The end of the bread was a bit tough, but other than that just delic!
Prices were also completely reasonable.
You'll be eating in a Best Buy parking lot, but rest assured I will certainly be back for more from this taco truck..
taco.author: Ritu K.
taco.review: I just polished off the tastiest torta and taco and felt moved enough to write a review. So so good!!! My al pastor taco was perfectly seasoned without being greasy (usually the norm for al pastor tacos). The pollo torta was equally as tasty. Once again my hands were not dripping in grease and the flavors were spot on.  The end of the bread was a bit tough, but other than that just delic! Prices were also completely reasonable. You'll be eating in a Best Buy parking lot, but rest assured I will certainly be back for more from this taco truck..

excerpts: Taco Tuesday done right.
Finally it was back, and for happy hour.
I decided to continue my adventurous streak (http://www.yelp.com/biz/bun-bo-hue-an-nam-san-jose#hrid:mTR_cmS5hlWDy1WodIQuzA) and ordered a cabeza taco and a lengua taco.

: Food ::

Cabeza taco (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/uGM7PAmP2utWXjYcZkVpQQ?select=_tn2zRGGu5KQ_zHyuhM9jw) is made with beef head meat and cheek.

It was dry and had a smokey flavor to it

Lengua (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/uGM7PAmP2utWXjYcZkVpQQ?select=ILBu52D4O8ALLXJlrWyjQw) taco is made with beef tongue chopped up.
taco.author: Christina C.
taco.review:
tacos and mexican coke!

Happy Hour Part 3 - the end

This truck used to come on tuesdays at my workplace. Tasty, greasy, and filling. This was Taco Tuesday done right. Finally it was back, and for happy hour. I was close to full after some yakis and belgian waffles, but I couldn't resist finishing off with some tacos.

I decided to continue my adventurous streak (http://www.yelp.com/biz/bun-bo-hue-an-nam-san-jose#hrid:mTR_cmS5hlWDy1WodIQuzA) and ordered a cabeza taco and a lengua taco.

:: Food ::

Cabeza taco (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/uGM7PAmP2utWXjYcZkVpQQ?select=_tn2zRGGu5KQ_zHyuhM9jw) is made with beef head meat and cheek. It was dry and had a smokey flavor to it

Lengua (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/uGM7PAmP2utWXjYcZkVpQQ?select=ILBu52D4O8ALLXJlrWyjQw) taco is made with beef tongue chopped up. My boss had quite the reaction when I told him (vegetarian) what I was eating. It was chewy but very flavorful.

The tacos came on a double layer of corn tortillas which weren't dry at all. But for me, a single layer would have sufficed (I pulled off the other layer).

:: Service ::

They screwed up my order and dumped onions on it. But they replaced it quick enough with another order. Thanks guys.

Good tacos.

excerpts: I mean if Indian, Chinese, Filipino, Korean, Southern Comfort Food, and French Cuisines can be made to 5 star quality, you would think the the "Taco" truck should have it mastered.
Maybe I got to go to one of their regular spots rather than one hired for catering.
I just expected more from a "TACO" truck.
taco.author: Veasna H.
taco.review:
I've been hearing a lot how good the El Tonayense Trucks are, so when i walked out of my building to get dinner, I was super stoked to see the Truck parked across the street.  Ditched my Whole Foods plans and illegally ran accross a busy 4th street.  

Turns out the truck was doing a catering gig, but they were cool with serving me.  We all know how good these trucks could be nowadays, and to see what thats actually serving real tacos...well they expectations were high.  

As much as I wanted it to be great, the carne asada burrito was okay, and the same goes for the Al Pastor tacos.  The flavor was good, but they were lacking the fullness of some of the stuff you can get at a taqueria or other trucks (forgot the name, but the one that was in front of the incase party was sooo good).  

Anyways, it was a good solid burrito, but I've had better.   I mean if Indian, Chinese, Filipino, Korean, Southern Comfort Food, and French Cuisines can be made to 5 star quality, you would think the the "Taco" truck should have it mastered.  Maybe I got to go to one of their regular spots rather than one hired for catering.  I just expected more from a "TACO" truck.

excerpts: My absolute favorite taco truck in the whole wide world!
They were there when I was once a poor intern working at 19th and alabama.
taco.author: J M.
taco.review:
My absolute favorite taco truck in the whole wide world! They were there when I was once a poor intern working at 19th and alabama. I would walk about 4-5 blocks just to get cheap $1.50, easy and filling tacos for lunch. 

Oh how I miss El Tonayense! I shall come and pay homage one of these days.

excerpts: Came here after a solid hike at a friend's recommendation..we love our taco trucks in LA but this is pretty damn good!
taco.author: Mich Q.
taco.review:
Came here after a solid hike at a friend's recommendation..we love our taco trucks in LA but this is pretty damn good! 

3 carne asada tacos. 30 seconds later. another 3 carne asada tacos please. 
That is how good they are! 6 tacos in a matter of 2 minutes. Its obscene but that;s how tasty they are. 

And then I had to run around the block to burn it off...

excerpts: A Michelin rated taco truck?
Is there such a thing?
Yep!
but it was a sunny taco sunday
taco.author: Betty C.
taco.review:
A Michelin rated taco truck? Is there such a thing? Yep! El Tonayense! 

Passed up this truck every time we went to Best Buys but it was a sunny taco sunday and we decided to try this place after doing a quick return at Best Buys. 

Cash only, tacos are $1.75 each. We got the asada, carnitas, and pastor tacos. Definite YES for the pastor and carnitas. Asada was only o.k. The truck also serves agua fresca and we got a yummy horchata to wash down our food. A perfect way to practice my Spanish too!

excerpts: The taco I had was pretty good, it's hard to judge an entire truck based on one taco, though.
The carne asada was pretty flavorful, had plenty of spice (I like), and was huge!
taco.author: Wally W.
taco.review:
I ate tacos from this truck during the gdgt Live event 2010.  They were free for the first 500 people, or so.  Their truck is so colorful!

The taco I had was pretty good, it's hard to judge an entire truck based on one taco, though.  The carne asada was pretty flavorful, had plenty of spice (I like), and was huge!

excerpts: Got the beef, tongue and neck taco.
Beef was dry.
For a taco truck, its decent.  $1.75 for 1 taco, cant really complain..
but then again, i had to eat 3 tacos to get full, whereas i can get 1 taco from elsewhere for $3-4 and be happy.
taco.author: Anna W.
taco.review:
Got the beef, tongue and neck taco.  Beef was dry.  For a taco truck, its decent.  $1.75 for 1 taco, cant really complain.. but then again, i had to eat 3 tacos to get full, whereas i can get 1 taco from elsewhere for $3-4 and be happy.  

Overall, its A-OK

excerpts: El Tonayense is a truck I have followed for years and have said over and over hands down the BEST taco food truck in the SF Mission district.
They park at 22nd and Harrison and usually there is a long line.
I always ask for beans and I love the carrots and peppers!
taco.author: Bahvee V.
taco.review:
El Tonayense is a truck I have followed for years and have said over and over hands down the BEST taco food truck in the SF Mission district.  They park at 22nd and Harrison and usually there is a long line.  I always ask for beans and I love the carrots and peppers!  Their meat never has fat on it and is tasty but not greasy or salty.  

When I saw that they were sponsoring the SF NACE March meeting at the SF Winery on Treasure Island,, I was ecstatic.  Always a great experience, and they cater too!  Check 'em out.  Tell them Babaloo sent you!

excerpts: while waiting they gave me a complimentary taco that was fresh and spicy on a corn tortilla.
The burrito was a great choice because they use a tasty rice and bean to compliment the steak.
A nice green sauce to go along with a few crunchy onions makes e burrito.
Walked by the area again the next day hoping
but they were gone.
Good show Tonayense!
taco.author: Jared M.
taco.review: This place rocked my sox off.  Just happened to be walking by and wanted to try a food truck while I was in San Fran.  This truck didn't let down.  I ordered the steak burrito and while waiting they gave me a complimentary taco that was fresh and spicy on a corn tortilla.  The burrito was a great choice because they use a tasty rice and bean to compliment the steak.  A nice green sauce to go along with a few crunchy onions makes e burrito.  Walked by the area again the next day hoping but they were gone.  Good show Tonayense!

excerpts: still the BEST taco...however, I was there last night and BEWARE ----

Beast Buy's security guy patrols the parking lot and when he sees that you're going to the taco truck, he will pull out his thick pad of paper that looks like the ticket pad the SFPD traffic pulls out to give you a ticket.
He will then ask you "how much is the taco?
" then proceeds to give a you a ticket....
oh, by the way, he says this with so much conviction since y'know...
taco.author: Jo'an R.
taco.review:
still the BEST taco...however, I was there last night and BEWARE ---- Best Buy will give you a ticket if you don't go in the store and buy something. 

Beast Buy's security guy patrols the parking lot and when he sees that you're going to the taco truck, he will pull out his thick pad of paper that looks like the ticket pad the SFPD traffic pulls out to give you a ticket. He will then ask you "how much is the taco? $78?" then proceeds to give a you a ticket....oh, by the way, he says this with so much conviction since y'know...he's big, tall and all that.  

I actually did not get a ticket since I went in the store to buy Timberlake's CD (I spotted the big guy looking around and figured what he was doing). But, the guy behind me wasn't so lucky. I honestly don't know if he got a ticket or not. 
But, beware of the beast guy --- oh, sorry, best buy's new parking policy.

El Tonayese STILLL has the best tacos, even though they always run out of radishes every time I visit.

excerpts: Definitely filled the need for spicy al pastor taco cravings, though three tacos did not seem like enough afterward.
At $1.75 a pop, it's cheaper than at the taquerias themselves.
Next time, I'm getting four.
They give you the tacos on a paper plate with limes and pickled peppers.
No plate cover unless you ask for one, then it's a foil.
Cold water bottles are $1 a pop.
Outdoor seating.
Taco trucks map y'all (http://www.yumtacos.com/).
taco.author: Peter L.
taco.review:
Definitely filled the need for spicy al pastor taco cravings, though three tacos did not seem like enough afterward. At $1.75 a pop, it's cheaper than at the taquerias themselves. Next time, I'm getting four. They give you the tacos on a paper plate with limes and pickled peppers. No plate cover unless you ask for one, then it's a foil. Cold water bottles are $1 a pop. Outdoor seating. haha.

Quickest route going towards 80E/Hwy101N is to take a left at the Vermont St exit, get to 16th St and turn right at Harrison St. Then look for the Best Buy and park there. It's also where to wash hands before/after - and also to browse their DVDs section so it then becomes a legit stop-in.

Taco trucks map y'all (http://www.yumtacos.com/).

excerpts: Best taco truck in the SF area.
Compares favorably to LA taco trucks.
End of story.
taco.author: Dom L.
taco.review:
I'm so pissed off that this truck was on check please bay area. I can just imagine every little wannabe is going to want to come here now and the lines will start getting outrageous. 

Please, if you ever, I mean ever go on check please, never give away places like this. Select a popular and proper little sit down restaurant and leave the hole-in-the-wall, local and neighbor joints to word of mouth knowledge only, or at most yelp. Don't spread it on tv; even if it is local tv.

Best taco truck in the SF area. Compares favorably to LA taco trucks. End of story.

excerpts: They take credit card so that's a relief compared to other taco trucks I've been to.
taco.author: Mark C.
taco.review: I love how they marinate their carne asada here. It's very unique compared to other places. The portion of the burrito is smaller than other places but each bite is pure bliss. Wish there was place to sit because I don't always come here with in car. They take credit card so that's a relief compared to other taco trucks I've been to.

excerpts: Each taco is simply made with two small corn tortillas (from a bag, not freshly pressed), the meat filling and a large glob of salsa that includes the obligatory cilantro and onions.
taco.author: Adam B.
taco.review:
Why not grab some tacos when buying a stereo system at Best Buy that is more expensive than your beat up, do-it-yourself-tinted car?  Someone sure saw that market opportunity!  If the parking lot ambiance doesn't suit you, trying noshing in front of the doggie play area a t the Wag Hotel... they are likely fans of this truck too.

Tacos: Each taco is simply made with two small corn tortillas (from a bag, not freshly pressed), the meat filling and a large glob of salsa that includes the obligatory cilantro and onions.  Relatively inexpensive for the neighborhood, you can try a wide variety for under $10.

Carne Asada: Well marinated and flavorful.  Appropriate crisp factor given that is grilled.

Carnitas: Could stand to be crispier.  Modest flavoring, a tad bland so the fattiness taste dominated.

Al Pastor: On par.  Good texture like the carne asada, but with a lot more spices!

Pollo: Shockingly one of my favorites despite chicken tending to be more boring.  Whatever they are stewing this in sure is working!

Pollo Asado: My only yuck!  The chicken was soft and rubbery with no signs of charring.  The marinade was weak or non-existent.  Dark meat is just not so tasty on its own.

excerpts: My favorite taco truck in the city, hands down.
I always hunt it down parked outside Best Buy and do
taco.author: Casey L.
taco.review:
My favorite taco truck in the city, hands down. I always hunt it down parked outside Best Buy and do a Foods Co run when I need groceries =).

Great selection for tacos, feel adventurous and try an organ like Tongue (Lengua) or Tripe (Tripitas) etc...They make for excellent tacos and taste similar to the tradition beef or chicken one gets accustomed to. 

I do my best to limit myself to 3 tacos at most *cries*, because I know my gluttonous self could consume way more if given the opportunity. 

Wait time shouldn't be ridiculous, as orders are made pretty quickly. 

Grab some Horchata and I'm hunkering down for a great meal. No problem standing as I want to eat my food as soon as it comes off the grill. I've had their burritos, and tortas, but tacos is my guilty pleasure here.

Parking is easy if you decide to park in the Best Buy parking lot and sneak off to El Tonyanese. I don't get full here, but these quick bites of food really make me happy. It hurts when they run out of something, so be diligent if you see this truck and get in line!

excerpts:
After noting that the truck was spotless inside and asking how much for a taco ($2), I ordered a sampler of 4 tacos:

The beef in my Asada taco was a little rubbery... 
did I order tongue by mistake?
The Al Pastor taco was tasty... pretty spicy.
The Carnitas taco was also tasty and juicy... pretty spicy.  
Ding, ding, ding!
The chicken kibbles on my Pollo Asado taco were dry and blah.
taco.author: John D.
taco.review:
The name just rolls of your tongue, doesn't it?

For starters, the menu is a little vague.  It lists only a selection of fillers for your items.  No prices.  The truck says "burritos", "tacos" and "tortas" so I presume you can get any of the fillers for those 3 options.  There is also no indication of what comes with any of them... I decided to just go with the flow and see what I would end up with. Oh, the anticipation!

Did I mention that the list of fillers include "head and cheek", "tongue", and "tripes"?  Um... giddy up, Silver!  C'mon Tonto... olé!

After noting that the truck was spotless inside and asking how much for a taco ($2), I ordered a sampler of 4 tacos:

The beef in my Asada taco was a little rubbery... did I order tongue by mistake?
The Al Pastor taco was tasty... pretty spicy.
The Carnitas taco was also tasty and juicy... pretty spicy.  Ding, ding, ding!
The chicken kibbles on my Pollo Asado taco were dry and blah.

Each of them came with some cooked onions, a bit of cilantro and there was a lime wedge on the plate.  I noted that another guy got two lime wedges on his plate of 3 tacos, but I only got one on my plate of 4. What gives?

I'm still a little hungry.

Here's the kicker: After I ordered my sampler, I wondered how I would ever be sure to receive what I ordered... the guy didn't take my name.  There were already about 15 people waiting for their orders.  Hmmm... how was this going to work? Well, there was lots of confusion.  The guy in the truck just barks out the item that's ready at any given moment.  It's up to you to remember what you ordered, translate the accent and battle it out with anyone else who might have ordered the same thing or something that sounds similar with that accent.  There were a couple of scuffles, but no fists flew.  One girl beside me wondered what she had ordered, 10 minutes after the fact.  You're on your own, kemosabe.

excerpts: This taco truck's burritos are severely lacking.
The grilled chicken here is at the absolute bottom of the list for taquerias, even below El Balazo and Zona Rosa on haight, which I consider average at best.
The burritos at this taco truck just seem cheap and bland compared to just about anywhere else.
Basic chicken filling
and that's about it.
Once I even had a gross purplish-bluish vein.
taco.author: Scott W.
taco.review:
I'm a huge burrito snob.  This taco truck's burritos are severely lacking.  The grilled chicken here is at the absolute bottom of the list for taquerias, even below El Balazo and Zona Rosa on haight, which I consider average at best.   The burritos at this taco truck just seem cheap and bland compared to just about anywhere else.  Basic chicken filling and that's about it.   Once I even had a gross purplish-bluish vein.  Plus the chicken itself is somehow prepared differently than any other Mexican joint in the city and not in a good way.

However the tacos here are pretty damn tasty.  I get the pork tacos and am very happy with them.  Why can't they put the same quality and care into their burritos?

In case you're wondering, burritos I'd consider great are El Burrito Express on Divisadero, Cancun and Pancho Villa.

excerpts: My favorite taco truck!!
taco.author: Stacey L.
taco.review:
My favorite taco truck!!

-Al Pastor Spicy Tacos $1.75 
(add guacamole & sour cream)

-Coke in a bottle or a Mandarin Jarritos

excerpts: I wasn't terrible hungry, so I opted for a Carnitas taco, as well as an Al Pastor...
Tacos were 1.75 each, it included a spicy pickle pepper for each also (pickled peppers are pretty much my weakness...)
Tacos come with 2 tortillas each so that they dont disintegrate from the juicyness of the meat +
If it wasn't for that, i would have probably felt it was a quarter too much for a taco...
But then again --- I am a sucked for pickled peppers...
taco.author: Mike V.
taco.review:
After a pretty ridiculously long walk from deep in the confines of the Mission, I made my way to Best Buy to return some piece of hardware or another... After stepping out, and in the mood for a snack, I decided to step up to the truck and check it out. Pick the type of meat (anything from chicken to carnitas, tripe to vegetarian.) Pick the vehicle in which you will consume said meat in --- tortas, quesadillas, tacos, burritos... And you are set!

I wasn't terrible hungry, so I opted for a Carnitas taco, as well as an Al Pastor... Tacos were 1.75 each, it included a spicy pickle pepper for each also (pickled peppers are pretty much my weakness...) Tacos come with 2 tortillas each so that they dont disintegrate from the juicyness of the meat + the lime juice you squeeze over it from the provided lime wedges.

The tacos were unbelievably delicious, and perfect portable, walking size. Ended up eating them as I walked home. They meats were super juicy (especially the al pastor!) The pickled pepper brought everything together for me. If it wasn't for that, i would have probably felt it was a quarter too much for a taco... But then again --- I am a sucked for pickled peppers...

excerpts: Fantastic tacos emanate from this humble taco truck parked by Best Buy.
Their signature smoky, spicy red salsa makes the difference.
And their soft tacos have just the essentials: corn tortillas, meat, chopped onions, cilantro and a wedge of lime.
The menu is simple (tacos, burritos, tortas, chips) but there are plenty of meat options and you can get veggie tacos too.
The two soft corn tortillas per taco make these easy to fold and eat.
I think any taco would taste great with their salsa, onions, cilantro and lime juice though.
I've also overcome my fear of the humble taco truck, so thank you El Tonayense.
taco.author: Lolia S.
taco.review:
Fantastic tacos emanate from this humble taco truck parked by Best Buy.  Their signature smoky, spicy red salsa makes the difference.  And their soft tacos have just the essentials: corn tortillas, meat, chopped onions, cilantro and a wedge of lime.  The menu is simple (tacos, burritos, tortas, chips) but there are plenty of meat options and you can get veggie tacos too.  They have drinks too (soda, water, horchata).

I had three tacos ($1.75 each).  The two soft corn tortillas per taco make these easy to fold and eat.  

* Neck - I thought this would be stringy (and it was).  It's like pulled pork.   Flavorful, seasoned well but fattier than I expected.    
* Grilled chicken - Chunks have great grilled flavor and they're not too large and not too small.  Delicious.  
* Head and cheek - My least favorite because the head and cheek meat was bland - reminded me of intestines but it comes in soft chunks.  I think any taco would taste great with their salsa, onions, cilantro and lime juice though.

You can get brains, tripe, tongue, al pastor, and carnitas too.  I like trying unusual cuts and my favorite (out of head & cheek, neck, tripe, brains & tongue) is lengua (tongue), followed by the neck.  I haven't tried brains and tongue here though.  Next time I'll get those tacos with extra cilantro.  Yum.  

I've also overcome my fear of the humble taco truck, so thank you El Tonayense.

excerpts: This past Carnaval 2011, I didn't mess around, heading straight to the El Tonayense Taco Truck!
Do the same, and your taste buds will dance around your mouth with joy!
taco.author: Delicious B.
taco.review:
Usually burritos are a bit disappointing, due to dry meat. 
My first bite of an El Tonayense burrito made my mouth do a double take (read as bite!).  My tongue could not believe it's luck!  A super moist burrito, with a little spice, not too much, like I asked.  By far, this was the best burrito I have ever had; experienced at Carnaval 2010.  They also, during the festival, after the parade, were friendly while whipping out the food surprisingly fast.  This past Carnaval 2011, I didn't mess around, heading straight to the El Tonayense Taco Truck!  Do the same, and your taste buds will dance around your mouth with joy!

taco.review: Their tacos are pretty good!!! We tried different types of the beef tacos. I enjoyed the Beef tripe taco the most because the taco guy made it crispy for us! Thank you!

excerpts:
This review is purely for hiring a taco truck for catering a party, I haven't eaten at the trucks themselves nor do I plan to.

My friend likes the taco truck idea, and keeps hiring El Tonayense to cater his parties, so I've had their food for several years now.

Why of course you don't, silly me for asking if a Mexican taco truck has salsa.
taco.author: Rob C.
taco.review:
This review is purely for hiring a taco truck for catering a party, I haven't eaten at the trucks themselves nor do I plan to.

If I could give zero stars I would.

My friend likes the taco truck idea, and keeps hiring El Tonayense to cater his parties, so I've had their food for several years now.

I have to believe the catered menu is a small subset of what is available on the street, and it is garbage. Bland tacos, bland rice, bland meat, bland everything, and limited selections. Example: they will make you a nice big cheesy quesadilla, but there's no salsa. Seriously.

"Can I get some salsa with this?"
"We don't have salsa."

Why of course you don't, silly me for asking if a Mexican taco truck has salsa.

"How about guacamole then?"
"I'll put some on for you."
(obviously wants to control the portion)
"I'd rather have it on the side."

He squirts some dubious green liquid from a plastic bottle into a Solo cup, and I realize that not only does he want to control the portion, but he doesn't want me to actually see the "guacamole" by itself. Why? Because it's absolutely disgusting. Flavorless green cream product is a more apt description, and there may have been one avocado per gallon of fatty cream, but the rest was food coloring.

No black beans either.

So, no salsas at all, no black beans, fake guacamole, and for this they charge $650 for 3 hours. 30ish people at the party, let's say average tab $8, that's a pretty good profit. Good enough to make some salsa, cook some beans, and slice a few avocados.

Oh, and to top it off, the cooks kept asking for beers from our stash!
Un-fricking-believable.

I wouldn't ever hire these people: incredibly mediocre food, expensive, lack of normal expected goes-withs, and furthermore they want to drink on your dime.

excerpts: This taco truck truly is as good as it gets when it comes to serving meat tacos and burritos.
The Pastor Tacos are so juicy and delicious, providing just the right amount of flavor for you to be standing there ordering one after the other.
The gentlemen working the truck are always friendly and there is an assortment of canned and bottled drinks aside as well.
I have started coming here over my usual places and well
, I guess you can say this is my regular taco spot now.
You must check it, it's worth the trip.
taco.author: Diego A.
taco.review: This taco truck truly is as good as it gets when it comes to serving meat tacos and burritos. The Pastor Tacos are so juicy and delicious, providing just the right amount of flavor for you to be standing there ordering one after the other. The gentlemen working the truck are always friendly and there is an assortment of canned and bottled drinks aside as well. I have started coming here over my usual places and well, I guess you can say this is my regular taco spot now. You must check it, it's worth the trip.

excerpts: -saw health score of 100 posted on taco truck.
-will
probably repeat, other times burrito was great and cheaper.
taco.author: Victor G.
taco.review:
don't know if this is the appropriate thread for the el tonayense truck parked at 16th & shotwell.

menu: tacos, burritos, tortas, 10 kinds of meats available plus vegetarian. no prices listed anywheres.

there wasn't much of a line so i ordered an asada burrito (6). surprised burrito price exceeded even some shop on mission (4.99) and equalled many shops on 16th st.

frijoles refritos:
-burrito larger than regular,  no salsa, chips, jalepen0s given.
-meat, onion, fluffy rice, beans, and salsa. taste was ok not great.
-cashier also made burritos by hand, not sure if he used gloves at any time.
-semifast, friendly service.
-saw health score of 100 posted on taco truck.
-will probably repeat, other times burrito was great and cheaper.

excerpts: My first taco truck experience.
taco.author: dan s.
taco.review:
My first taco truck experience.  I had heard about this truck and passed it on my way back from paying for a parking violation, so I had to stop (after I pretended to go into Best Buy so the parking lot gestapo wouldn't yell at me).

They weren't the absolute best tacos I've ever had, but they were tasty, the ingredients were fresh, and the tab for two tacos and a large horchata was only $4.50!  Their tacos are definitely on the smaller side - I thought about going back for a third, but figured I'd save room for next time.

excerpts: And being a "taco truck" and all, I'm very glad that they're even still there that late.
taco.author: Ed L.
taco.review:
Another recommendation from Check Please. You'd think I'd couldn't find anything myself!

I tried two items (tacos and super burrito) so far on different days and I'm a fan! Their Carne Asada and Al Pastor meats are very good. Next to try is the Pollo Asado. Unfortunately, they ran out by the time I would typically get there (6:30pm). And being a "taco truck" and all, I'm very glad that they're even still there that late.

So, this'll be my burrito stop on my way home now.

excerpts: Reading the news clippings pasted in the window of this colorful truck, I find out that foodies from near and far trek to this specific taco truck for their Mexican food fixes.
I tried the things that I traditionally judge Mexican restaurants by: al pastor burrito, carne asada quesadilla, a couple of tacos (carnitas), and an agua fresca (pineapple).
The al pastor burrito was good, although it really kind of just tasted like a chorizo burrito.
But I guess that's the flavor profile for the al pastor.
The quesadilla was average.

The cilantro salsa sauce was really good, but the quality of the meat was just 'eh', and I think they either left out the sour cream and guac from my super quesadilla or they put so little in that it was non-existent.
But hey, at least you can just park in the Best Buy lot for this taco truck and the service was pretty quick.
taco.author: Saunders C.
taco.review:
Who am I to argue with Michelin? Is it possible that some of the best carne asada is to be found parked outside of a Best Buy? 

Reading the news clippings pasted in the window of this colorful truck, I find out that foodies from near and far trek to this specific taco truck for their Mexican food fixes. I tried the things that I traditionally judge Mexican restaurants by: al pastor burrito, carne asada quesadilla, a couple of tacos (carnitas), and an agua fresca (pineapple). The al pastor burrito was good, although it really kind of just tasted like a chorizo burrito. But I guess that's the flavor profile for the al pastor. The quesadilla was average. The cilantro salsa sauce was really good, but the quality of the meat was just 'eh', and I think they either left out the sour cream and guac from my super quesadilla or they put so little in that it was non-existent. The agua fresca wasn't that great, either. 

Overall, not bad, but given all the other fabulous choices that you have in the Mission just a few blocks away, I'd have to opt for one of those. But hey, at least you can just park in the Best Buy lot for this taco truck and the service was pretty quick.

excerpts: However, this isn't a burrito truck, this is a taco truck!
taco.author: Ian P.
taco.review:
As some of the previous reviews have stated, the burritos here can be iffy. However, this isn't a burrito truck, this is a taco truck! Their tacos cannot be beat. 

And yes, I would like this truck at my party!

excerpts: I never leave hungry when visiting the Taco Truck..
You're great!
taco.author: Emily L.
taco.review:
I never leave hungry when visiting the Taco Truck.. You're great! don't ever change.

This is the BEST Mexican joint in SF!!

excerpts: Taco's are the the star.
Pork.
Spicy.  radishes on the side.
peppers.
taco.author: Clifford S.
taco.review:
Quick.  Cheap.  Good.  Taco's are the the star.  Pork.  Spicy.  radishes on the side. peppers.  So good.

Burritos are good.  Decent size.  Not oversized.  Fresh.  Juicy.  

Always a good stop for a quick and good lunch.

excerpts: The tacos also look insanely good though I've never had enough inner strength to pass up the torta to give the taco a proper go.
taco.author: Kenneth L.
taco.review:
This is for the Tonayense that sits outside the SOMA Best Buy (Harrison & Duboce). 

People are giving these guys bad marks based on burrito reviews. WRONG. You need to be getting the TORTAS. It's a rookie mistake and I completely understand. I've been in that boat before but quickly learned what's up.

I can always count on these guys for a solid, quick torta fix. In fact, I only count on THESE guys for my torta fix. I've tried a handful of other taquerias' tortas and they just don't hold up - missing the chopped up tasty carne asada (most places will give you a "cold cut" style piece of meat), the tasty, toasted bread and the green sauce. Oh my lordy, the green sauce...

The tacos also look insanely good though I've never had enough inner strength to pass up the torta to give the taco a proper go. 


I also want to add that you can't beat the parking situation - the huge Best Buy parking lot.


WARNING: The guys behind the plexi-glass window will swear up and down to you that they're there until 9pm every night but if you're feening for that mexican silver bullet of goodness and the time is closing in on 830pm, you should be formulating a plan B. I speak from experience.

excerpts: $1.75 per taco
and they have a lot to choose from.
Plus parking is a breeze (I usually park in Best Buy if I can't find one on the street shhh...).
I always get the two  al pastor and a carne asada taco.
Both are great.
I have tried the tripe, tongue, and head and cheek taco
but it really wasn't my cup tea.
My boyfriend however, ALWAYS gets 4 tripe tacos.
taco.author: Lyly P.
taco.review:
Benny you are making me fat!  My ass is getting bigger, and people keep asking me if I'm pregnant.  Well I guess that's what happens when you eat three tacos twice a week, but it is totally worth it.

First of all it's cheap!  $1.75 per taco and they have a lot to choose from.  Plus parking is a breeze (I usually park in Best Buy if I can't find one on the street shhh...).  I always get the two  al pastor and a carne asada taco.  Both are great.  I have tried the tripe, tongue, and head and cheek taco but it really wasn't my cup tea.  My boyfriend however, ALWAYS gets 4 tripe tacos.  Yes, people think he is with child as well...

Come try out this place.  It is SUPER clean, and I see the guys wash their hands all the time.  Trust you will love it.

excerpts: Best taco truck in the city!!!
They have a groupon for this place however you need to print out the groupon to bring in rather than claim it on your phone.
Despite this one inconvenience, I still give it a 5 star rating.
taco.author: Krystle A.
taco.review: Best taco truck in the city!!! They have a groupon for this place however you need to print out the groupon to bring in rather than claim it on your phone. Despite this one inconvenience, I still give it a 5 star rating.

excerpts: I LOVE this taco truck.
I always get the chicken tacos, spicy.
The chicken is moist and the flavor is great.
It can get busy but the line and service moves quick!
taco.author: Ashley N.
taco.review: I LOVE this taco truck. I always get the chicken tacos, spicy. The chicken is moist and the flavor is great. It can get busy but the line and service moves quick!

Me:  Felicidad.

excerpts: I've been feeling lately that the true home of the taco truck is LA.
Tonayense delivers everything in the right portions: good tortillas, decent meat, pico de gallo, all with a dash of "deliciously sketchy" and low prices to go with it.
It's a big chain now, though, but a good one if you ask me.
Try their cabeza if you haven't had it before.

Tonayense delivers everything in the right portions: good tortillas, decent meat, pico de gallo, all with a dash of "deliciously sketchy" and low prices to go with it. It's a big chain now, though, but a good one if you ask me. Try their cabeza if you haven't had it before.

excerpts: You get a good amount of meat on the taco, so two is usually enough to make you stuffed!
taco.author: Cynthia H.
taco.review:
Delicious al pastor tacos, for $1.75 each.  You get a good amount of meat on the taco, so two is usually enough to make you stuffed!  The horchata is also pretty good.    

Great meal if you're on a budget!  Be prepared to eat on the sidewalk or the parking lot of BB.  Yum Yum Yum!

excerpts: The best reason to go to Best Buy in San Francisco might just be there proximity to the El Tonayense Taco Truck.
Dirt cheap tacos with a lot of flavor.
Hard to distinguish one protein from another, but it's good just the same.
Park at Best Buy, eat in your car.
taco.author: Dave B.
taco.review: The best reason to go to Best Buy in San Francisco might just be there proximity to the El Tonayense Taco Truck. Dirt cheap tacos with a lot of flavor. Hard to distinguish one protein from another, but it's good just the same. Park at Best Buy, eat in your car.

excerpts: $1.75 for a taco.
taco.author: Jane L.
taco.review:
Instant Gratification

Sometimes I just want a small, but delicious bite to eat that doesn't fill the tank and break the bank.  El Tonayense carne asada and lengua tacos fit the bill.

Loaded with a few bites of meat, onions, cilanto and garnished with radish and lime, Tonayense's tacos pack a flavorful punch and can be eaten in just a few bites!  That's what I call good eats!

$1.75 for a taco.

excerpts: This taco truck is ever dependable.
taco.author: Jun B.
taco.review:
Two thumbs way up for seriously tasty tacos and seriously cheap too.  Long before the city was inundated by tweeting street food carts, there was El Tonayense.  My favorite location is at 14th and Harrison.  This taco truck is ever dependable.

http://blog.junbelen.com/2009/11/19/el-tonayenses-tasty-street-tacos/

excerpts: If it is your first time eating here, I recommend that you go for the taco, as it is much smaller than the burrito and you should sample one of each meat.
I usually order them with single tortilla skin and I can chow down 1 taco in just 2 bites.
I think I'd need 10 tacos to feed me completely!
taco.author: Handoyo S.
taco.review:
El Tonayense is one of my favorite lunch destinations. It serves up great tacos and burritos with fast and friendly service, the latter remarkable considering they're serving it up from a truck.

They serve plenty variety of meat here and if you're adventurous in your choices, this is my list in descending order: 1) Neck (Buche), 2) Tripes (Tripitas), 3) Tongue (Lengua), 4) Head & Cheek (Cabeza); but they're all gorgeous and I gotta have them all. I've never had any of their 'normal' meat so I can't comment on them.

If it is your first time eating here, I recommend that you go for the taco, as it is much smaller than the burrito and you should sample one of each meat. Once you're more of a veteran, then maybe you can focus and and get the burrito, with your favorite meat.

The tacos portion are kinda small though. I usually order them with single tortilla skin and I can chow down 1 taco in just 2 bites. I think I'd need 10 tacos to feed me completely! But the burrito is huge and just 1 order should be enough.

And one last thing to say, if it's not late at night and you're craving for some tacos/burrito, head to this place first and not that over-rated El Farolito, you will not regret it.

excerpts: I've heard about the famous taco truck for the past 2 years, but had yet to stumble upon it.
Finally, while walking with my roommate, we came across the taco truck and were overcome with excitement!
I use to think you could not get quality food from a taco truck but Tonayense changed my opinion.
taco.author: Surge C.
taco.review:
I've heard about the famous taco truck for the past 2 years, but had yet to stumble upon it. Finally, while walking with my roommate, we came across the taco truck and were overcome with excitement! If there is one cuisine I am passionate about it is Mexican food.

I got carne asada tacos and let me tell you they were some of the best tacos I have had. I am a very picky eater, especially when it comes to Mexican food. I use to think you could not get quality food from a taco truck but Tonayense changed my opinion. The guy who serves the food is super friendly too.

Tonayense is an SF treat!

excerpts: The best taco truck in San Francisco.
It's a bold statement, but in my opinion, it's really true.
This particular el tonayense truck is parked outside the Best Buy on the SOMA/Mission border.
One of the great things about it (besides the food) is how it brings local SF flavor to something as universally common as a Best Buy.
It's the perfect taco truck.
taco.author: Tolga E.
taco.review:
The best taco truck in San Francisco. It's a bold statement, but in my opinion, it's really true. This particular el tonayense truck is parked outside the Best Buy on the SOMA/Mission border. One of the great things about it (besides the food) is how it brings local SF flavor to something as universally common as a Best Buy. I love the juxtaposition.

Anyways, the food is why you go here. Their al pastor tacos, at $1.50 each, are an amazing steal and seriously are some of the best mexican food in northern california. It's all fresh, it's all made-to-order, and it's unbelievably clean. This truck receives 100% on the annual health inspection every single year...that's far more sanitary than the majority of fancy expensive places in this town. 

The al pastor is the show-stealer for me, but they also do chicken, carne asada, and the more exotix lengua (tongue) and cabeza (head). You can also get Jarritos or Mexican Coke in glass bottles, which is always a plus. Parking is easy because you can park in the huge Best Buy lot. It's close the freeway and covenient. 

It's the perfect taco truck.

excerpts: Great chain of taco trucks.
The asada burrito is one of the best in San Francisco.
taco.author: James B.
taco.review:
Great chain of taco trucks. The asada burrito is one of the best in San Francisco. Their hot salsa is tough to beat.

The tacos are good for SF but still not on caliber with LA trucks

7 bucks for a super asada burrito is a bit much for a truck

excerpts: One of the best taco trucks in the city!
Even better than some dine-in taquerias!
taco.author: Lloyd A.
taco.review: One of the best taco trucks in the city!  Even better than some dine-in taquerias!

excerpts: For some reason I have heard loads of good things about this taco truck but my beef burrito was just mediocre.
I ordered the beef burrito, spicy, with no cheese or sour cream.
I forgot to say no beans because the beans inside my burrito was huge!
Los Compadres taco truck on spear/folsom is way better.
taco.author: Terry D.
taco.review:
Meh. Unfortunately I won't be coming back.  For some reason I have heard loads of good things about this taco truck but my beef burrito was just mediocre.  I ordered the beef burrito, spicy, with no cheese or sour cream.  I forgot to say no beans because the beans inside my burrito was huge! Gross. 

The super burrito is actually a really skinny burrito someone my size (5'1 110 lbs) can easily polish off.  It was also really wet inside.  I like my guac looking like guac - green and chunky.  This guac looked like it was mixed with sour cream because it was really watery and mostly a whitish color.

Texture of the beef was questionable.  It actually taste like ground beef.  Hardly any rice in the burrito too.  Definitely not spicy enough.

Overall, just ok.  For $6.50 you can definitely find a better burrito elsewhere. Not a truck I would go back to.  Service is quick though.  We got our food in under 5 minutes and there wasn't much of a line around noon time either.  Los Compadres taco truck on spear/folsom is way better.

excerpts: This taco truck sucks!
taco.author: Jean L.
taco.review:
I saw this on KQED's CHECK PLEASE and happened to be in the neighborhood so I decided to try a beef (carne asada) burrito.  I asked if it came with cheese but he said that's only in the super burrito that also includes sour cream and avocado.  The super burrito was only 50 cents more but I didn't want the sour cream.  He then agreed to give me the "regular" burrito with cheese.

It came fast but when I bit into it, I found the burrito had very little filling and was almost 50% flour tortilla.  For the $6 price, I could have gotten a decent burrito almost anywhere in the Mission district.  Besides the small amount of filling, the meat was soooo salty I couldn't eat it.   It also wasn't good quality meat.  I'm use to getting chopped or shredded grilled steak when I order a carne asada burrito, not steamed ground beef.

This was a major disappointment.  They get two stars simply because the person who took my order was nice and accommodated my request for cheese with the "regular" burrito.  The food does not live up to the CHECK PLEASE hype.  If you want a good burrito, go to La Taqueria on Mission & 24th or El Toro on Valencia & 17th.  This taco truck sucks!

excerpts: I love the cabeza taco, real flavorful chunks of  cheek and flesh there.
My recent favorite however has been the regular al pastor torta.
They butter the bread for extra deadliness.
taco.author: Mia G.
taco.review:
I love the cabeza taco, real flavorful chunks of  cheek and flesh there.  My recent favorite however has been the regular al pastor torta.  They butter the bread for extra deadliness.  The servers are always nice too.

torta + horchata + best buy restrooms for washing my hands after all that spicy goodness = joy

excerpts: When I first hear "taco truck", I thought "food poisoning.
I've loved this place since I first tried the carne asada taco.
It is absolutely delicious!
The flavour is outstanding, and believe me, once you've finished your order, you'd want more.
taco.author: Bianca W.
taco.review:
When I first hear "taco truck", I thought "food poisoning." I am glad to say, I am so very wrong. 

I've loved this place since I first tried the carne asada taco. It is absolutely delicious! The flavour is outstanding, and believe me, once you've finished your order, you'd want more. I am not surprised that it gained a Michelin recommendation. 

If you are by the neighbor hood, definitely stop by.

excerpts: Best Buy is lucky to have them out front because I've spent money in there just waiting for the taco line to die down.
And I've also been to the El Tonayense on 24th, and strangely the tacos were less delicious.
taco.author: Paul M.
taco.review: Radical tacos!  Best Buy is lucky to have them out front because I've spent money in there just waiting for the taco line to die down.  And I've also been to the El Tonayense on 24th, and strangely the tacos were less delicious.

excerpts: My husband and I make excuses to go to Best Buy about twice a month, so we can actually hit up the taco truck that's parked on the street next to it.
taco.author: Amy H.
taco.review:
My husband and I make excuses to go to Best Buy about twice a month, so we can actually hit up the taco truck that's parked on the street next to it. It took me a few visits to really appreciate this truck, but now my mouth waters whenever we're anywhere near the area. 

I've tried the carne asada, pollo, and carnitas, but my absolute favorite is the al pastor tacos - a perfect amount of spicy, tender pork complimented by fresh onion/cilantro relish and salsa verde, and a squirt of lime. I love how the juices drip down from the other end as I bite into them. 

Served on flimsy paper plates, we usually end up eating while standing on the sidewalk, but these tacos are so delish that we practically inhale them within five minutes anyway. Yum!

excerpts: This taco truck offers LOVE at first bite.
And who cares that it was 4:30pm, the perfect time for a taco snack!
taco.author: Misha F.
taco.review:
AY CARAMBA!

This taco truck offers LOVE at first bite. 

I innocently made a trip to Best Buy, but felt myself falling deeper into love with every bite of my two carne asada street-sized tacos. $4.50 for two tacos and a soda. YUM. And who cares that it was 4:30pm, the perfect time for a taco snack!

excerpts: So I was pleased when I could get the basic taco fare for a really cheap bill!
Fast service and super delicious.
taco.author: Cory M.
taco.review: I'm generally a picky eater. So I was pleased when I could get the basic taco fare for a really cheap bill! Fast service and super delicious.

excerpts: if you're a human being who loves to eat, period, you owe yourself a trip to any one of El Tonayense's taco trucks in the city.
My 2 cents would tell you to make sure you get an Al Pastor (marinated pork) anything...taco, burrito, or maybe they'll even put a couple spoonfuls into a bowl...not a bad idea either.
The asada and carnitas are also amazing.
taco.author: Jarrett T.
taco.review:
If you're someone who loves Mexican food...wait...if you're a human being who loves to eat, period, you owe yourself a trip to any one of El Tonayense's taco trucks in the city. 

The quantity and quality of reviews speaks for itself. They even proudly display their city health inspection score of 100. My 2 cents would tell you to make sure you get an Al Pastor (marinated pork) anything...taco, burrito, or maybe they'll even put a couple spoonfuls into a bowl...not a bad idea either. The asada and carnitas are also amazing. Their salsas and marinades are what really kick it up a notch and separate themselves from the pack. 

I recently was quoted by saying, "I think I could eat these tacos everyday of the week" and I'm willing to back up my talk. Won't you join me?

excerpts: taco thursdays!
taco thursdays!

but you know it's the taco truck parked right out of best buy!
i always get the same thing.. carnitas tacos with mild sauce.
i've also tried their spicy (red) sauce as well, but there's definitely more flavor with the mild green sauce.
taco.author: Lina W.
taco.review:
taco thursdays!
taco thursdays!
taco thursdays at tonyanese!! 

actually, i could never remember the name.. but you know it's the taco truck parked right out of best buy! i always get the same thing.. carnitas tacos with mild sauce. i've also tried their spicy (red) sauce as well, but there's definitely more flavor with the mild green sauce. and from time to time, i like to mix it up with horchata. 

and 5 stars for the guys who work here who always gets our 6-different-tacos-with-extra-lime orders correctly. there's no better way to spend a thursday night!

excerpts: Poor taco didn't even have a chance to cool down.
Unfortunately taco love does not come cheap here, as $1.75 is on the high end even for a taqueria, let alone a taco truck.
And I could do with less salsa.
But I'm not complaining.
taco.author: Mike W.
taco.review:
El Tonayense! We meet at last.

Your intoxicating perfume of meat and spice draws me close. I salivate and tremble with excitement as I barely get out the words lengua and pastor . . .

The wait, it's almost unbearable! Fortunately the burritos and tacos are flying out at a frenetic pace, and soon I have a plateful of your succulent seared flesh in my hands. Now, we dance.

It's a beautifully sculpted mound of meat drenched in salsa resting on supple tortillas. Sweetness gives way to heat, and the lengua crumbles tenderly. A couple more judicious bites and it's polished off. Poor taco didn't even have a chance to cool down. I move on to the pastor.

I give a quick squeeze of lime and rearrange my jalapeno slices. I devour luscious bits of pork in a maniacal frenzy. I try to savor the moment but all is powerless against my appetite as the tacos disappear from the plate. I recline in my seat, and I lick my fingers clean. That hit the spot.

Unfortunately taco love does not come cheap here, as $1.75 is on the high end even for a taqueria, let alone a taco truck. And I could do with less salsa. But I'm not complaining. This was so good, so very good.

While I'm still an El Paisano devotee (my first, won my heart), I'll never forget our sordid afternoon affair. Oh El Tonayense, we'll do this again!

excerpts: I will never find another taco better than this.

One time he called me homie.
:D
taco.author: Chris L.
taco.review: I come here for the tacos. I will never find another taco better than this. I buy 3 at a time since they're small and delicious. Those guys are really nice. Not intimidating at all. One time he called me homie. :D

taco.author: Daniel S.
taco.review:
IGNORE THE HYPE.  These are just OK tacos -- not bad, but not worth any Best of the Bay either.

Tried the usual trinity, but they were out of carnitas.  Instead had carne asada, pastor, and pollo asado.

Carne Asada: overcooked downer meat, not much fun.

Pastor: Greasy, red, greasy.

Pollo Asado: Best of the bunch.  Not extravagant, but tasty.

For $1.75 a pop, this ain't Oakland.  And not a great deal either. 

Maybe this is the kind of taqueria where you should have the burritos instead. 

Seeking more taco trucks?  See my Mexican food list here:
http://www.yelp.com/list_details?list_id=7moDaSk5jQWRZ76X3AbyFA

I only had one, though I wanted eight.  It's a good thing this truck isn't in my neighborhood and that I'm usually nowhere near it most of the time because I'd get one of those cool fishing chairs and park my ass for DAYS.
