excerpts: and now I actually go out of my way to hit up this taco truck regularly -- and I am a vegetarian!
Ask for the cheese quesadilla -- with green salsa in it -- HEAVEN!
They grill it
so it's just a little crunchy and perfectly melted inside.
Seriously, it's the best cheesy goodness in SF, and yes, I am familiar with the Mission --
this Taco truck has em beat.
taco.author: LAH H.
taco.review: I'll admit that I am a bit of a snob when it comes to eating out of a moving vehicle, but my fiance convinced me that I would love this place years ago and now I actually go out of my way to hit up this taco truck regularly -- and I am a vegetarian! Ask for the cheese quesadilla -- with green salsa in it -- HEAVEN! They grill it so it's just a little crunchy and perfectly melted inside. Seriously, it's the best cheesy goodness in SF, and yes, I am familiar with the Mission -- this Taco truck has em beat.

excerpts: i love taco trucks....and it finally took me this long to try the ever so famous El Tonayense!
I normally dont come out to this area or the mission very often (prolly 2x a year max--parking sucks and the area is sketchy)...
but thank god for this truck parked at the best buy!
I can park in the best buy lot, grab a taco or 3 and eat 'em up on the street.
I had the tongue & the carne asada (mild salsa)...
i liked the carne asada more than the tongue
b/c
it had a lot of flavor to it (and prolly the extra grease) than the tongue.
However, the tongue is really tender as well.
I took a bite of my bf's cheeks & head taco (hehe, dirty mind....) and that was very tasty as well...
i would order the brains
taco (oh come on, havent you had cow brains before???
cures migraines all the way thru
---it's true, my gramma used to make cow brains herbal chinese soup..never had headaches for years!!!)
but anyways, i dont really trust this place for cow brains--its a truck for god's sake...
thats a reasonable--b/c after all, that stuff to make a taco doesnt even add up to a $1.00?!
i love taco trucks so much
, i'd still come back & i want to try their other items (i.e. burrito/tortas)
taco.author: Yolanda L.
taco.review:
i love taco trucks....and it finally took me this long to try the ever so famous El Tonayense! I normally dont come out to this area or the mission very often (prolly 2x a year max--parking sucks and the area is sketchy)...but thank god for this truck parked at the best buy! I can park in the best buy lot, grab a taco or 3 and eat 'em up on the street. 
I had the tongue & the carne asada (mild salsa)...i liked the carne asada more than the tongue b/c it had a lot of flavor to it (and prolly the extra grease) than the tongue. However, the tongue is really tender as well. I took a bite of my bf's cheeks & head taco (hehe, dirty mind....) and that was very tasty as well...i would order the brains taco (oh come on, havent you had cow brains before??? cures migraines all the way thru---it's true, my gramma used to make cow brains herbal chinese soup..never had headaches for years!!!) but anyways, i dont really trust this place for cow brains--its a truck for god's sake...the brains must be fresh, clean, and properly handled!

so anyways., minus 1 star b/c i think $1.75/taco is a little steep...if it was $1.25/taco then thats a reasonable--b/c after all, that stuff to make a taco doesnt even add up to a $1.00?!

but b/c i love taco trucks so much, i'd still come back & i want to try their other items (i.e. burrito/tortas)

excerpts: I went for the $5.50 Super Torta, which came piled with beef and oozing with a sauce filled with cheese, guacamole, salsa, green onions and sour cream.
It was a huge mess to eat out of the quadruple-wrapped aluminum foil, but I managed.
Jamie had the $6 Super Burrito, and he was having the same overflow issue.
We decided to park ourselves next to the wall of the Best Buy where passersby gawked at us.
super torta.author: Ed U.
super torta.review:
Tongue taco!...Tripe taco!...Brains taco!...Head and cheeks taco!
Name an internal organ...they'll put a tortilla around it...Que Aproveche!

Y'know, I think "Check, Please! Bay Area" is starting to become more of an addiction than I care to admit. I've passed by this truck many, many times, but I didn't think twice about trying it until a guy on the show chose it as his favorite culinary destination and even brought sample tacos for the other guests. Impressive...though I was wondering how successful his dates are if this is what he considers fine dining.

Now I'm no snob when it comes to food made in a motor vehicle. In fact, I'm a sucker for the 53rd and 6th Halal Cart every time I go to New York (http://www.yelp.com/biz/53rd-and-6th-halal-cart-new-york#hrid:jVK8_2qtXO3UU7R5hS9XIg) There are three of these El Tonayense Trucks around the Mission, but this one is an instant draw since you can just park in the huge Best Buy parking lot. Jamie W. and I got there at around 8pm, and they were down to just beef as the meat selection.

I went for the $5.50 Super Torta, which came piled with beef and oozing with a sauce filled with cheese, guacamole, salsa, green onions and sour cream. It was a huge mess to eat out of the quadruple-wrapped aluminum foil, but I managed. Jamie had the $6 Super Burrito, and he was having the same overflow issue. We decided to park ourselves next to the wall of the Best Buy where passersby gawked at us. Don't judge us.

FOOD - 4 stars...good, hearty stuff...darn fresh ingredients...need to come earlier so I can pick out my favorite internal organ
AMBIANCE - 2 stars...you're kidding, right?
SERVICE - 4 stars...andale, andale!
TOTAL - 4 stars...cheap eats on wheels...bring your own card table...and folding chair
